name: Nancy Tupper
text: I was greeted with respect . Very curiosity. I got to look and pick what I wanted and no one came trying to sell me something else. So I was able to constraint on what I was looking for. No regrets.

name: Katherine Barrett
text: When they delivered my love seat, they put a hole in my living room wall. I expect this company to repair my wall. Now it has been 2 months and they are giving me the run around  about fixing the damage they caused to my wall. I would not recommend them. Still waiting for a matching couch on back order to be delivered also. Hmmmm.

name: Misty Merilien
text: Bryan did an excellent job explaining discounts, fabric protection, and the functionality of the furniture. This store has great quality furniture with even better prices. My husband and I are well pleased with our experience!

text: Great people very helpful. The delivery  guys are great and deserve a raise

text: The people are very nice there

resp.text: Hi Damita.  Thank you for leaving a 5-Star review!  At Farmers Home Furniture, we continuously strive to serve you better.  We are glad that our team has met your expectations.  We look forward to serving you again in the future!

name: Jennifer Rhodes
text: Just got approved for some new stuff I love it and they whsre helpful

name: Dodge Ram
text: Employees sitting all behind the counters and no one seem to know what was going on. Been doing business there for a few years but wont be buying anything g else there.

name: Danny Ayala
text: Girlfriend paid for the extra coverage/furniture insurance on her couches and dining set. Upon delivery, table was damaged when moving it to the dining room. OK... Then stools last a few weeks before the got wobbly, and the braces that held the seat to the stool broke off and a dowel broke off making the seats totally unstable. This happened to 2 seats. Took the stools back to be replaced or repaired, as stated with the extra coverage, and they said the tools to fix it haven’t came in yet. It’s been over 6 months! And there’s a Marvin’s 3 stores down! Also, we took back a seat cushion that was ruined (zipper broke off) and that hasn’t been replaced yet either. Stores weren’t shut down in March so they can’t blame the delay on that. If you buy from here, don’t waste your money paying for the extras like extra coverage on your furniture. They’re just trying to make some extra money with no real plan on how to honor that promise.

name: FMB
text:
Aaron's. We sell furniture!

But then again I never came to buy furniture, so...pass?

resp.text:
Hi,  We greatly appreciate your business and we VALUE you as our customer!
--Anna Hi FMB, Thank you for the 4 stars! We greatly appreciate YOU!

name: Zacaria Purse
text: I wouldn’t even leave one star if it would let me but the manager at this store is very rude! I initially went to take one of my family members to get a bedroom set from them, everything had already been approved online and during the phone call my family member got, they said the only thing they would need him to do is bring in a ID & they’ll be ready to set up a delivery date. When we got there it was a whole different story, the store manager was very rude demanded that I put my name on the lease agreement just because I was there with a family member. She didn’t have my permission to put my name on the lease agreement and still did so. After I told her that I didn’t want my name on there , she refused to take it off! Then she said that my family member wasn’t approved for anything after he got an email saying he was! I wouldn’t recommend this place at all, you’ll be better off going to spillers, your way, or another furniture company!

name: Jaime Redick
text: Bought a brand new TV from here and it messed up. They gave us a much smaller loaner TV to use while ours was sent off for repairs. We were told the repair would take a week and then we would have our TV back. It is going on 5 weeks now and still our TV is not back and no answers given when called... they should communicate better with their customers or replace with the same size loaner since they don't know how long it will be...

name: Whyyy Though
text: Kim is the Truth!! She ALWAYS takes Care of ME, MY NEEDS & EVEN WANTS"-- She Has Been such a dependable Employee & Friend. I'm THANKFUL to know n have her on my team. U GO BEAUTIFUL'~ p.s. Tell Your Husband he's 1 Lucky Man"-- Strong 💪 Women like Us Barely Exist or Even Break Ground Any More'~ The Real AARON'S M.V.P.!! She needs a Extra Promotion she's been around a long long time. XO's 💘 U KIM signing out 4 Now Jeri Bickerton...

name: B Bkhd
text: The Best Thing about this location is Mrs. KimKim ☺ She has the most upbeat personality and she's extremely helpful an very knowledgeable. She's a great asset to this location. Thank you Kim

resp.text: We are happy to hear that! And thanks for the great rating! -- Phil

name: JF Jackson (Stormy)
text: Awful place to rent from. We chose a couch and love seat online and they delivered late. The next day my husband went in to get a different one and at first was told we would have to pay 3 months in advance for a different one. My husband picked on he liked and asked if it was new and they said yes. They told him they only had 1 delivery guy so he would have to help. Luckily they sent two! But I have two blown discs and this couch was not supportive(like it had been sat on a lot) so we on week left and contacted them on Monday about picking it up. My husband was told they only do it on Tuesday so no refund either. They were scheduled after 3 and showed up before 1 pm unannounced to pick it up.My husband was still at work which left me nothing to sit on until he came home. I have bought several things from Aaron's in Florida and this place is awful compared to other Aaron's.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear this, and thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will look further look into this issue for you. If you have any additional information, please email us at myexperience@aarons.com. Thanks -- Phil

name: Andrea Howell
text: Great store to lease towards ownership!

name: Tanya Phelps
text: Very helpful and got me what I need

resp.text: We are happy to hear that! And thanks for the great rating! -- Phil

name: Vickie Hollingsworth
text: Rented a tv online went yesterday gave the info they needed wsd told would be delivered at 11 called was told they had a big deliver still havent heard from them called at 430 was told he just got back from lunch was told he was loading it up 603 still no tv nor phone call

resp.text:
Hi Vickie,

Sorry to hear that you have had this experience.  Can you send an email to myexperience@aarons.com that includes the primary name on your lease, the local store that you work with, your email address and your best contact number?  Look forward to hearing from you!  Thanks ---Chelle

name: Tonya Morris
text: They would not let me rent from them because where i leave at even when they didnt have to deliver i live 5 miles away

resp.text:
Hi Tonya,

We are sorry to hear of your experience with your local Aaron's store. We will forward your concerns to our Divisional Management Team. -Tavius

name: Jennifer Clauson
text: I went in Monday about 12pm and the lady was so rude and acted like she didn't want to help me and 4mins later she was walking out and got in her gold color car to leave

name: Jennifer Brake Brooks
text: The lady was very rude! Very short spoken!!!   Will not be going back nor buying anything from them.

name: Greg Gilmore
text: Bad business I went in on Saturday and pay for a refrigerator and I was told it would be deliver on Tuesday and I still don't have it

resp.text: We are sorry to hear this, and thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will look further look into this issue for you. If you have any additional information, please email us at myexperience@aarons.com. Thanks -- Phil

name: Kathy Judd
text: Never went to Aarons

name: Walt Gay
text: Good selection and prices

name: Jake Shumard
text: Ed's can do attitude and expertise are highly appreciated and recommended.

name: Fred Smith
text: He fixed my ice maker  was happy with his work

name: Elizabeth Campbell
text: He came on time and did a great job. The refrigerator quit working again and he only charged for the part. I'll use him in the future.

name: Ivy Madson
text: This is a very honest business with reasonable prices. I called to get our washer fixed and he was able to come out in a very timely manner and fixed the washer quickly. Our fridge broke today and I called Ed. He said the next appointment he had was tomorrow. I told him I didn't want everything to spoil and he quickly referred me to another company who was able to come out today. I'd recommend Ed's Appliance to anyone in the area. You can't beat the service, price or integrity.

name: Brian Maddox
text: Called and he came out the same day and fixed the problem with my daughters dryer.  Price was great!  He was professional

name: Brianna Lewis
text: Worst ever! Don’t waste your money or time. Guy didn’t have definite answers. It was “probably” or “maybe” answers. I called about two appliances but once he got here, there was only one appliance malfunctioning but he tried to charge for both! He had an attitude and continued to take phone calls during the “diagnostics”. He also made smart and snide comments under his breath. If I could give it less than 1 star I would.

name: David McLeod
text:
Timely, excellent service.
House call within 24 hours; friendly, solid work backed up with a guarantee, all for a reasonable price.  Will definitely call again for any other home appliance issues.

name: Nicole Hall
text: The atmosphere is great! Soups a Plus! And Foods are also good good Good!

name: Constance Calambakas
text: Prompt and Courteous.  Would definitely call him again and recommend him to friends.

name: Benita epps hallmark
text: Called to set up repair service on a washer. Never came, never called

name: Alaska G Parker
text: Good  work Good  job

name: Karen Vance
text: Extremely courteous, efficient and competent!  Will definitely use this company again!

name: Cody Humphrey
text: Fast, professional, honest. Definitely recommend and will use them again!

name: Sandra Corbin
text: This no longer here.  He's deceased.  I own the building and its empty

name: Melvin Mccollough
text: Terrible customer services my appointment was at 1pm and 1:15pm I call to see what was going on and they said we running behind about two hours, when was anybody going to call me after I get off work waiting on them and he had a nasty attitude. I wouldn’t refer my dog to this company.

name: Oakley Melton
text: Today is 8/10/16 and Ed is alive and well and does good work.

name: Nicole Burnett
text: These people will blow your phone up for missing one payment or even two payments. Farmers home payments are way cheaper and they understand if u have a problem plus better quality furniture. When i pay these people off i will never go back again.

text: My 300 BLK OUT wasn't working for me and I needed to find a rifle in the middle of hunting season, esp since I am newbie. Mike hooked me up with a  Ruger Creedmoor 6.5 and ammo. He bored it for me and I am zero'ed and one shot and one kill.

text: Great service all the way around. They were able to work me in a day ahead of time and fixed my fridge in one outing.  They even gave me some preventative tips for another appliance I've had problems with.

name: Mary Cartwright
text: Putting this comment on here so you can be warned the first product I got from here was an LG 3d tv it quit working they fixed it but brought it back with a white edge on the corner to this day it still has it almost like they may have dropped it or something was pushing against it. I DIDNT COMPLAIN.  the next was a washer which had to be repaired I believe like 2 or 3 times well the last time they fixed it they brought it back damaged dented scratches on the front sides and top a missing piece of plastic on the door and guess what I called and they never called back. I felt like they didnt want to admit to it and I questioned if this was even the same machine. I was disappointed but we thought we would try them one more time.. this was the absolute worse time too I'm hoping management reads this. But me and my husband got a nice furniture set. Well the couch has been nice the electric recliner is starting to squeak but no complaints wood is in tact so it's fine but the absolute worse is my recliner. We have had it almost a yr the arms were worn upon arrival. Called and it took about 2 months for the repair man to come because of surgery.he refused to fix it said it was too much work because of the damaged wood. Well a week before he came I made a call telling them it was having trouble reclining they told me the repair man would fix it. Well I looked under the chair and saw damaged wood and couldnt believe it. Next time I ever rent furniture or any of you please ask to see under the chair before purchase. Take pictures before and after arrival. The bottom was damaged and the side that the recliner button is on is almost falling apart. They actually told me they would pick it up to fix it after hounding them for months to the point I actually had to go up there to have anyone return my calls  manager assured me it would come back not damaged after all the other products. GUESS WHAT!! came back with a poorly sewn RIP. STILL HAVING TROUBLE RECLINING! the bottom wood has been fixed but the wood around the recliner button is more damaged than ever. I HAVE SI JOINT DYSFUNCTION RA AND POSSIBLY FIBROMYALGIA ALONG WITH DIVERTICULAR DISEASE SO THAT MEANS I CANT TAKE THE MEDICATION TO TREAT MYSELF AS IT FUTHER DETERIORATES MY COLON. I want to be able to recline without having to almost stand up to make it work. It used to be delayed but now it's almost getting impossible to recline and that poorly sewn RIP was a cover up they ripped my appolsry. BY THE WAY I CAN SEE THE FOAM IF THAT PAINTS U A PICTURE. The arms are a little saggie still and yet I just want it fixed the manager after me calling three times decided instead of handling the situation he was going to take the day off? PLEASE AARONS FIX IN A TIMELY MANNER WE PAY YALL IF YALL HAD NO CUSTOMERS YOU WOULDNT HAVE JOBS. 2 MONTHS IS TOO LONG TO NOT HAVE FIXED THIS. (Not including the yr we have waited) I DONT APPRICIATE THE QUALITY OF THE BUSSNIESS YALL HAVE GIVEN US. thank you for taking the time to read to anyone who wants to hear a real review and for yall as a company to understand from a customer how this looks and feels to be left in the dark. Edit: contacted corporate. District is looking into the situation I'm glad I found out about it. Willie has been avoiding talking to me so hopefully we can get help. We have made all payments on time and have tried giving bussniess after everything that has happened. It's almost been a week now and he is still dodging me due to being "busy". UPDATE just contact corporate you can look up Aaron's corporate number they have been a tremendous help.

name: Melissa Fruzan
text: I would give a zero if offered! We have a whole home generator that runs off of propane. The only thing in our home that uses propane. We have had a Blossmas Gas tank since we moved here 5 years and we know for sure that the tank has been here for 15 or soyears.  Rent has been paid religiously every year, the only thing is that we don’t use very much propane! Of course unless we have a hurricane or another disaster that makes the power go out! Well when we got our bill this year, there is an additional $64.00 charge on our rental bill. When we call, we are told that “the tank isn’t making us any money just sitting there!” And “we have a new tiered system that the charge will be based on how much you use it!” This isn’t ethical! I’m sure it isn’t legal either! Steer clear!!!!

resp.text:
Good Afternoon,

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We emailed the address on your Blossman account discussing your situation.

Sincerely,
Blossman Gas

name: Marc Mott
text: I came by to get a cylinder filled and no one could do it. Thanks.

resp.text:
Thank you for providing feedback. We do recommend calling your local Blossman store in advance to make sure someone is available to help with a cylinder fill.

Sincerely,
Blossman Gas

name: Thorn J
text: I took my friend here for their Black Friday sale. We entered, an employee was sitting at the table and didn't get up, not even to greet us or read the advertisement - in front of an elderly woman with a cane. We asked to see the Nintendo Switch Lite; she brought us the Switch (the original). We asked to see the gray Nintendo Switch Lite, she brought us the blue. Took a few more tries to get the gray one and she took as much time as possible to bring these to us, even though they were mere steps behind her. She tells us they are $399 - the price of the original Switch. I show her that Nintendo themselves sells the Switch Lite for $199. Her response? "We don't price match here." I'm sorry, you don't price match the manufacturer? You're really going to have the audacity to charge twice the manufacturer's price even when confronted about your dishonesty? If you like being scammed and your intelligence insulted by the employee's inability to do basic elementary-level math, look no further than this predatory hellscape. The store itself reeks of ingenuine intentions and cheap carpeting.

text: Do NOT buy from Farmers. It is a scam.  Overpriced furniture, extreme interest rates and $4 Charge for a phone payment because they haven’t set up online payments.  Translation: we will charge you an extra almost $50 per year because our extreme interest rates and outrageous markups aren’t enough.  It’s 2020; there is NO good reason to not offer an online payment option.  I don’t believe you “just haven’t set it up yet.”  This is your design to squeeze more money out of your customers.  I am trying to help a friend get out from under your thumb.  She will be wiser next time.  I will tell anyone who will listen not to buy anything from this store.

All I can say is this Farmers Furniture on Opelika rd. is the absolute BEST!!  What fantastic customer service, and so nice and professional!!  ONCE again, I HIGHLY recommend Farmers!!  They stand behind their product!

name: Lillian B.
text: Farmer offers great customer service at the time of the purchase but after that service is downhill. After two months of having my couch the base board broke. It took 3 months for the manager to come fix it. After that the decorative pillows that came with the sectional began to rip at the corners of the pillow. It took 3 months to get a new pillow. I've have my couch for 9 months now and all of the decorative pillows are coming apart. I was told new ones would be ordered and be there in 5 days, its been three weeks now and records show nothing was ever ordered for me. There is a lack of communication between the manager and the person who orders new products. There is also a lack of concern for the satisfaction of the customer. I paid my furniture off within the first 6 months of owning it. I was going to go back to purchase more, but after this I will not be shopping at that location again. Good luck to those who do.

name: Kirkland Brown
text: Since we got our couch. We’ev been missing a piece. Yet we paid full price & they assured us it was going to be here in two months almost 3 months l8r. No other piece & still more excuses. Just go to a REAL furniture place. They can’t even call us & give us updates.

resp.text:
I am very sorry you are unhappy  Mr. Brown
Unfortunately I think you have the wrong furniture store as we do not have you in our system as having made a purchase with us.

However,  I would like to address your complaint about a furniture establishment.

Unfortunately for most businesses selling anything in America we are faced with challenges that are out of our control. For example,   there are shipping delays from overseas of products that are needed here for the assembly of furniture and chips for new cars.  Because of those delays dates change every day. When we do let our customers know a date, it can change the same afternoon which frustrates the customer even more.

Before the Pandemic, we could deliver on 90% of our goods within a 2-4 week time period. Now we cannot promise any date...the only thing we ask is that you hold on to your old furniture until your new furniture  arrives. We have even loaned out new furniture while a customer waits.
We have wholesale prices right now to help with that unfortunate waiting period. Some items come in next week after delivery, but some do not. It varies with every piece.

We value our customers, and if we could change what is going on in America we would . We go above and beyond for all of our customers. I just ask that you try and understand the circumstances that all retail establishments are having to deal with and navigate through. They are difficult, and we are all trying our best to get your items here as quickly as we can.
Factories in America are also understaffed, and those who are working are doing their very best as well. Transportation is trying to find more drivers, so that items can also be delivered in a timely fashion.
We have kept our prices  lower than anyone  to help better ease that frustration of timely delivery dates. So it is a great time to purchase from us, but patience will be needed in case dates change on an item.
Thank you so much for your understanding, and if you did purchase from us under a different name - I am sorry for the delays, and I too wished we had control over dates fluctuating.

name: Catherine Hatter

They greet you with a smile and are willing to answer any questions you have. The prices are also amazing! This is an all around great place to purchase all of your home decor needs. Ask for Brian!

Thanks so much for the kind review!

name: AJ
text: Still haven’t received my furniture and it’s been months. I understand the pandemic has slowed things down but it’s ridiculous. These people don’t even update you on the shipment, you’ll have to keep asking them yourself. Not a good look. If I paid in full for something you should be updating me frequently not the other way around. Won’t be shopping here again.

resp.text:
I am sorry that you feel we have not kept you informed more frequently about shipment dates.
I know we have spoke on several occasions, and emailed each other.
Every retail establishment in the country is having issues with receiving product in a timely manner. It is totally out of our control, and if we could change things we would.
Delivery ETA's change daily and weekly, and that is why we cannot truly set or promise delivery dates.
When we have spoken, I told you what it stated at that present time.
When we spoke later, and that date was different and longer it frustrated you more.
What you used to take 4-6 weeks has been now doubled. Sometimes it comes quicker which is a blessing. We take pride in Customer Service, and it is certainly not my intention to not properly inform you of shipment dates. We did provide you with a loaner while you wait which I do not believe any one else is doing.
My sincere apology if you felt like we have not provided you with the best service possible.

resp.text: We are a non profit organization and our mission is to help families in need. Our merchandise is priced according to other non profit organizations. We have to make money to pay our employees, and utilities, as well as raise money for the Habitat homes. I am sorry you feel this way. As far as you feeling like you were being followed, I reassure you that if an employee was following you it was not done on purpose. name: Carroll Hosey6uy vv
text:
Changing my rating to a LESS THAN ONE STAR FOR BOTH LOCATIONS!!! I was so happy to originally give good rating to Alexander City store, I had found the 2 Lazy Boy recliners I had been searching for.... and she checked to make sure they were NOT on back order.. so image my surprise that now, 18 days later than they were promised, I STILL HAVE NOT RECEIVED THEM, they have not been delivered to the store. I should have picked them up on April 2nd. Since then, I have been told "they will be on our next truck, call back Tuesday" "call back Friday"  "I called and verified that they would be in our warehouse the 16th" I'm leaving my original post, so everyone can see the whole story behind trying to get 2 recliners from your store!
I live in Sylacauga and went to our local Badcock store. I found the recliner that I had been searching for and asked if it was available in a different color. The sales lady rushed to answer "No" without checking their website or trying to verify her answer... I left there and went online, found the lady had lied and it WAS available in the color I wanted. So I drove to a neighboring city store and found a sales lady who was more than eager to help me... so I give the Sylacauga location a 1 Star rating, but the Alexander City location gets 5+ stars! Very happy with the lady there! Too bad I couldn't do business in my hometown.....

resp.text:
Hi Carroll,

Our sincerest apologies. Customer service is a priority for us, and we're sorry to see your experience was a disappointing one. Our Corporate Team would like to look into this for you. If there is anything we can do differently that might better serve you as our valued customer, please reach out by calling 1-800-223-2625 or email customer.service@badcock.com. I worked there and people of color should honestly find elsewhere to rent ...

Babers company does NOT care about any employees, they barely care about the stores and I say that because the owners barely to never call or come by unless it’s a problem then you’re getting scolded by 5 people! I worked as an account manager doing allllll the managers responsibility but not being compensated for it. It was my responsibility to call due and past due customer but when I make contact with anyone the manager stands over my shoulder telling me exactly what to say and I can’t stand being micromanaged . I had to use my own personal Facebook for sales and my personal cellphone for advertising. I used my personal cellphone for collection calls . Most customers are extremely rude. And the store manager didn’t make it any better with the things he wanted you to say . The store manager said “I think this job has made me racist” and it shows in his work he will rent quicker to white people than blacks and he is quicker to offer “help” to white customers than blacks. The store manager has adhd or something he can not focus and puts all his task down on me . He is impossible to work for, some days he doesn’t ask you to do anything other days he ask you to everything AND his job! He was never on time and always left early and takes long breaks. A lot of the time I was NOT allotted a lunch break but when I look at my pay stub the time was taken out of my check . You have too many responsibilities that you are not paid for ... Oan the store is really slow but the manager threw away the chairs and doesn’t want you to sit ! And wearing babers uniforms are mandatory and you have to buy them yourself and the cloths are overpriced and cheaply made JUST LIKE THE COMPANY ITSELF !

name: Lisa Sells
text: I see the office I went into to pay my bill now has an automated payment system! I refused to use it! I like the personal interaction with the employees that process the payments! Yes, I understand that other power companies are going all automated! I'm not so secure with all the computer technology! They do have the ability to have failures! So many businesses have confidence in computers storing their information! Some of us will always be old fashioned, no matter our age! Nothing wrong with having records on paper! Thank you for letting me voice my opinion! I will give this office a 5 star rating because the employee was extremely kind & did her job well!

I spoke to them to remind them of our agreement, and they will not stand behind it. They say it is a different washer than we agreed on yesterday (although it is the same one). After getting behind on one payment I called to pay the month up even though we were coming up on the due date for the second month and was told that 100 wasn't enough and even offered to come pick up my refrigerator until I paid the other 100$ I owe...I couldnt belive my ears after already making 14 payments of over 100$ a month..not to mention the cold response and the lack of empathy they showed me told me that this is not a company that cares about customers only the money they are owed..and after I pay off the account it will most likely be the last business I do with them..this was my honest experience take it or leave it...

name: Bertha Dozier
text:
LONG POST ALERT

I ordered a king size bedroom set and was told it would be arriving in 3 1/2 weeks.   The week of delivery I received a phone call from Miguel stating the bedroom set had arrived minus the dresser and mirror.   He went on to say that another set that was similar to the one I ordered was available.   I told him I would come in the store to look at it.  I ordered a grey bedroom. The one that was available was black.   Two different colors.   Told them I would take the one that I ordered and wait for the dresser and mirror.   Day of pick up, load the headboard, footboard and chest.  They tried to get me to sign the paperwork accepting delivery.   Refused because I was missing 2 nightstands and the rails.   They found the rails but no nightstands.   Was told the missing items were in the Mobile store.   I was promised that I would receive the items early Saturday. It's now 9:45 pm and still no delivery.   I have sat at home all day waiting on a non existent delivery.  Not a good way to conduct business.

resp.text:
Hello Bertha,

We are sorry to hear about any troubles receiving your purchase as expected and would like to help as best we can. Please call 1-866-388-6333 so we can put you in direct contact with the Vice President of the store location you purchased from.

text: I had an horrible experience with the manager (Ojay) very rude and unprofessional!!!! My reason for waiting was because She used her personal cash app to to take my order over the phone i went to American Freight once to try to receive my refund when I got there everyone act lost as if they had no clue how what was going on or how to refund due to the cash app. I then waited that following Monday for Ojay to call me like she said for my refund and of course no call. I waited later that Monday and called for them to tell me that “Ojay said that i will have to let money go back to her card to pay be since it was cash app... I told the workers that it was fine i just wanted my refund. Still no apology or anything just a run around . name: Josh Yates
text:
Overall, I'm satisfied with my purchase at the Montgomery, Alabama location.  Management was very good.  Prices seemed to be excellent.  Quality seemed to be excellent.  Selection was very good.  The -2 star is because of my delivery.  I paid $75 cash for delivery, which is fine.  But, after all my furniture was placed inside my apartment and the delivery men left, I failed to check to make sure everything was delivered correctly.  The next day I open the box that contained my headboard and it was the wrong size and color.  Management had a new headboard delivered to me, but the delivery man refused to take back the incorrect headboard because he said, "I don't have the paper.", so I took the headboard back to the American Freight warehouse.

Within the next few days, I opened the mirror to my dresser and it was the wrong color.  I took the mirror back to the American Freight warehouse and management swapped it out for me.  In the end, I happy with my furniture but it appears my $75 delivery cost was wasted on my end due to the driving back and forth a few times to fix a few mistakes the delivery men made with my purchase.  Before the delivery men leave your location, double check your furniture.

name: Kori Anderson
text:
DO NOT BUY FROM AMERICAN FREIGHT IN MONTGOMERY! They are very unprofessional and unorganized. We bought basically a whole house worth of furniture, when it was time for delivery they informed us that our sectional was not in stock and that it’ll be in stock in 2 weeks and that they’ll deliver it out to us with no delivery fee but we could still get our bedroom suite that we ordered.
Incident #1: On delivery day I had to call and ask what time would the furniture be in because we were out running errands. They forgot to put our furniture on the truck and the delivery people had to come back and get it🙄 (I’m sure if I had not called I would not have known)
Incident #2:Two weeks later, which was on yesterday (Sunday) at around 12pm I called and spoke with OJay and asked was our furniture in. She told me yes(why didn’t they call?) and that they can deliver it out same day. Okay cool. She then called back and said that we didn’t pay all of our delivery fee which in fact when they delivered our furniture the first time my boyfriend gave them the delivery free PLUS A TIP. She then told me that it was okay and that they would take care of it. Later that day, at 4pm, I called again just checking to see what time they would be coming. The guy I spoke with asked would I be okay with getting it delivered first thing Monday morning. Uhh no. (My problem with this was WHY DIDN’T ANYBODY CALL, I would be okay if they had the common courtesy to inform me of any issues instead of me having to call them.) The guy told me my furniture should be at my house no later than 10:45AM(I didn’t know how if they opened at 11am) I asked was he sure and he said yes.
SO THIS MORNING MY FURNITURE WAS NOT AT MY HOUSE AT 10:45! I called promptly AT 11am and spoke w/ the manger Rodney and he informed me that a driver was on the way to get my furniture to deliver it. If my furniture was not able to be at my house at 10:45AM they should have communicated that with me. I received my furniture at 12pm after all the mess I had to go through. I appreciate it if you guys would be more professional with your customers and communicated more with your drivers. I should not have to go through this hassle of getting furniture delivered and I WILL NOT shop with you guys again. Have a good day!!

name: Rachel Bu
text:
TL/DR: furniture took more than 2 months to arrive, company was no help over the phone, leather sectional arrived with corner scuffed. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Full story: I shopped at American Freight on Black Friday 2017 with high expectations after reading these reviews. And the experience in the store was fine. No pressure to buy, but a helpful staff answering any questions my husband or I had. We bought a sectional and ottoman set we liked even though they weren't available for delivery for 2-3 weeks. We were fine with the delay and left looking forward to it arriving in a few weeks (more time to find homes for our old stuff).

That's when the trouble started. Fast forward 4 weeks, no sectional and no call/news at all. I call the store and was told that my purchase wasn't on the truck as expected, but they would be calling other stores to see of they had it and we should hear something the next week.

Life was busy so I didn't check again for another 3 weeks. This time when I called I was told they didn't know why, but it was on back order. But it would for sure be in the next week. I again expressed by hope that it would arrive as I very much looked forward to using my furniture.

2 weeks later, no furniture.  At this point, 2 months after purchasing the furniture and as my husband and I are both active duty military and didn't have the time to go to deal with it, my mother-in-law visited the store on a Friday. She made a bit of a scene stating the facts in front of other customers, and wouldn't you know it our sectional and ottoman arrived on rush order the following Monday. Corners were scuffed in some areas, and a few tears from packing staples, but at that point we were so glad to have the furniture  and tired of dealing with the company that we accepted it anyway. I will never shop there again  and highly recommend you don't either.

name: Wes Stigsell
text:
We decided to shop here due to the great reviews and the quality furniture and a great prices . However the great reviews must be only for furniture that they have in stock. The couch and love seat we really liked was not in stock and we were told it would be two weeks until our furniture would arrive This was 15th of July. It even said August 1st on the sales receipt.  Two weeks go by and we heard nothing. We called American Freight and we were told that they don't have a date that the truck will show up it will just show up one day. Three weeks out we had heard nothing and we're told it would take 2 to 4 weeks. At this point we would of asked for a refund and shopped somewhere else but their policy states you can get a refund after 4 weeks from purchase.  Now four weeks arrives still no furniture still no date a truck will arrive.  We call on Monday with all intentions to ask for a refund and were told there is a truck and the Manger will be in on Thursday for us to get a refund. Thursday comes no phone call from American Freight we call on Friday and we're told oh your couch is here. Alot of effort on our part to find the status on our order. So after 4 weeks and several days of a family of 5 sitting on the floor since we just moved to Montgomery we have our couch and love seat. When we picked them up we told them we were still in the market for furniture and we were told to come back and they will give us a good deal for being so patient  well why not give us a deal while we were there. We won't be back.
Going back to the day we purchased the furniture the couch and love seat we wanted they actually had in the back but it was already sold to a customer who was waiting for it to be delivered some sales people were telling our sales person to just give us that one but we would not do that to someone else. So it puts into question did our furniture arrive weeks ago and they sold it to someone else it's possible especially since they could never give us a date our furniture would arrive.
We do like the furniture but if you shop here and they don't have it in stock BEWARE you will never know when you will get it.

resp.text: We do apologize for the inconvenience, Wes. If there's anything we can do to rectify the situation, feel free to send us an email to social@ameircanfreight.us. Thanks!

name: Sylver Hooks
text: A few months ago, my husband and I purchased a dinette set from this location. When it was delivered, the delivery guy Preston had noticed they sent the wrong chairs but I had noticed the box with the table looked as if it had fallen off of the truck or dropped from a distance. After bringing in the table, they left and came back with the correct chairs. After putting together the chairs, I opened the box containing the table and it had indeed been dropped. It was well after store hours at this point but I still called the delivery guy with my issues. The next morning at 11 sharp, I got a call from the owner. Like he has obviously done before, apologized for it and said that he's send another out by the end of the day. TWO DAYS later, the table finally arrived. They opened the box to make sure that nothing is busted up and I was very pleased with the way it was handled. I was so pleased that we decided to order two more chairs from them. We were told that it took 2 weeks for the chairs to arrive. It was November 27th and we needed them before Christmas. Before they ordered the chairs, we had to pay and that wasn't an issue for us. We paid the full balance of nearly $180 for two Madrid. counter height chairs. Two weeks go by and no chairs. I was told that the truck hasn't come in but I'll definitely have them before Christmas. December 22nd, I gave them another call and I was told that I could pick them up the next day. I was overjoyed to hear that. On the 23rd I got a call from the manager telling me to not come because they wasn't there and he didn't want me to ride there for nothing. He said that he was just have them delivered when they came in. The delivery guy Preston brought to our home at 6pm that night. He told me that they were in a different box because they opened it to make sure that they sent the right chairs because of what happened the first time. Trusting his words, i signed for it then took them upstairs myself. I placed them in a closet, grabbed my things and left home until Saturday night. Christmas morning I pulled out the box, opened it and removed all of its contents. I then took the box to the dumpster. When I returned, I settled myself down to begin assembling the chairs only to find that the chairs HAD ONCE BEEN ASSEMBLED. There were marks on the chairs, the screws were stripped and rusty. and the floor protectors were very worn. There were also four screws missing as well. There were hand smudges all over the wood. There was nothing about those chairs that said NEW. In complete disbelief that Rodney the store manager for charge me full price for two chairs off the showroom floor then have me wait nearly a month to receive them made me a bit irate. Without thinking, I called the store on Christmas morning. After realizing, I messaged the delivery asking for the cell number of the manager and I've yet to receive an response. So as a result, I feel it's very necessary to be waiting in the parking lot with two unassemble Madrid counter height chairs and several questions that gonna require an answer as well as a solution. Until this, I thought very highly of American Freight and its coworkers. Now it's BUYERS BEWARE... there's a reason they say that all sales are finals. For me, I don't want my money back because I do want the chairs. I just want what I paid for and I DID NOT pay for recycled chairs

resp.text: We're very sorry to hear this happened to you, Sylver. If there's anything we can do for you, feel free to email us at social@americanfreight.us. Thanks!

name: BYRDIE Yeah
text:
My eldery mother and i were just there yesterday looking at some furniture and i did
Not like our experience there at all. The salesman who served us had these real long dreadlocks and his salesmanship skills were the pits...he did not sale my mom and i what we wanted, what we liked nor did he offer to
Show us anything decent that would also fit
In our budget. Yes thats right he never showed us anything on sale nor did he bother to ask what our spending limit was so he know what to work with. Instead he just showed us around the store that highlighted
The furniture with the 699 and up prices.
We spotted a black leather sofa that had 398 price tag on it, sat on it to try it out, and as we began to show insterest in it and began discussing to each other about maybe we should get this or not. Thats when the salesman kinda brushed us away from the actual sofa set that we were sitting on that was 398 and started reverting us back toward that 699 plus tax sofa set. Smh thats not the sofa set we wanted or was discussing.we felt that the salesman wasnt offering us what we wanted but yet offer us what he wanted us to buy.....and we are the customers...its our money not his....we felt like our wants were disreguarded so we decided to check another store, told the guy we were gonna check somewhere else also before we decide. Asked him for a bussiness card and of course he didnt want to give us one and by him doing so gave us even more reason to be absolutely sure that we dont want to shop there now.
So as we started to walk out the door the guy then decided to offer us a deal on a sofa set
...A BETTER PRICE is what he said so im like oh ok he wants to work a deal on the actual leather sofa we were sitting on with the 398 price tax. So im like ok turn around and ask what are you offering...he reply...600 right now walk out..we refused and left and went somewhere else because once agin the guy was still attempting to sale us what he wanted us to buy rather than what we the customer wanted to spend our money on...

name: Jaime 0212
text:
Very disappointed in the service.  I purchased a NEW dishwasher December 21st.  Marquez was extremely helpful!  I can't rave about him enough.  My issue came when I was told my dishwasher was in stock in Bham but due to the holidays their 1 installer wouldn't be able to install until after all the holidays.  Okay, I understood the desire to take a break and be with family.  After January 4th I still never heard from anyone to schedule my install.  I finally called on January on January 8th to track down someone to help get this installed.  They were able to come install my dishwasher on the 13th.  The gentlemen that installed my NEW Bosch dishwasher made me aware that the 3rd row was shipped with broken clips so it wouldn't work but that's okay they would have someone come right back out to fix the issue.  After several days of no communication I once again called the store and was told oh yea Shane can come out on January 25th.  Great! Finally I will be able to use my new dishwasher properly.  Shane arrives on the 25th with a 3rd row for the dishwasher.  He was NOT informed properly of the problem and only had the drawer itself.  So once again Im left with a dishwasher that can not be utilized to the fullest.  Shane tells me he will go back to the shop and grab the clips off of another dishwasher and be back to fix the issue.  I wait and wait.  I finally get a hold of Mike on February 5th.  He informs me that the job has been listed as complete!!!  There was no order to get new clips there was nothing listed as needing to still be fixed.  Mike tells me that he will call me back before the end of day OR call me on Monday February 8th to tell me what can be done.  Again, I wait!  I called today the 12th a FULL MONTH after my dishwasher was installed.  Mike tells me oh those clips are on back order.  I asked for some type of date as to expect them he states could be end of February.
My issue is the POOR COMMUNICATION!!!!   1st. the installer NEVER reported the correct issue with my dishwasher had he done so properly Shane would never have come to my house with the wrong part.  2nd Shane completed the job.  This is a HUGE FAIL!!!  3rd. Mike never contacted me to let me know there is no part readily available and it will be back ordered.  When I reached out as I've had to do every since they took my money back in December Mike acted a little confused to why I would be calling.

I expect better when paying for a top of the line appliance.  I've gotten better service from a big box store!  I understand parts get broken in the box and no one is aware but this should've been taken care of in January! This was NOT a warranty issue as it was delivered to me broken!!! The product was not ever used.  I am NOT happy that I will have to wait until March to fully use my dishwasher the proper way.  The whole reason I came to All South was the earliest Bob Wallace could get the dishwasher installed was March 4th!!!  If I had known I would be stuck until March to begin with I would've gave Bob Wallace my money!

name: Jason Newell
text:
Allsouth was the appliance sub for our builder (who is outstanding, by the way).  All they had to do was install three appliances.  THREE.  The only thing these jag-offs got right was the delivery of the appliances and *sliding in* our new oven.  The dishwasher and microwave were both dropped.  This was obvious because (a) we saw the palette in our garage prior to installation, (b) one side of the palette was "injured", (c) the corresponding sides of the appliances from that side of the palette were both broken.

To add insult to injury, they didn't use the granite counter installation kit for the dishwasher.  This would help considering they don't want to fix the broken feet.  Now, when you open a loaded dishwasher, the whole machine rotates thereby "dishcharging" the bottom rack of dishes out onto your floor.  This is entertaining to guests.

The microwave is also fun.  The plate does not rotate properly so you can always tell when it's in use because of the "thump-thump" made by the turntable, much like a broken record but without the repetitive music.  Also, the clock is crooked so you can't tell if it's AM or PM (which actually matters during the winter when it's dark at 5AM and 5PM).  And the oven vent built into the microwave is broken so it slides right out after only unfastening two screws when it should be held together by four screws.  The other two take bits of the broken plastic housing with them.

Normally I wouldn't care because these appliances are "builder grade" but it's the principle of the matter.  Allsouth is not interested in fixing or replacing the appliances which can be done EXTREMELY EASILY when you're a flippin' vendor.  They're only interested in minimalist work, single trips, and offering to "send out an inspector" which was already been done by the builder who verified that the pieces are indeed broken.  We're guessing Allsouth doesn't trust the builder that hired them in the first place.  They also will not come out on your time, only their time, so if you work and are busy from 8am to 5pm, you can bet you'll never see nor hear from them again.

name: JoJo Campbell
text:
Always had a great experience from Allsouth Appliance until today.  I called a week ago and requested service on my refrigerator and they scheduled me for today, between 8 and 12.  I rearranged my schedule so that I could be home for the four hour period. I decided at 9:00, this morning, I should call and confirm.  I was told their service technician is out sick for a couple of weeks and they had transferred my appt to "Service Care" in Birmingham.  I asked for a number to contact them for a confirmation.  I called Service Care and spoke to a really nice many who was shocked that I was expecting them today because they had just gotten the information yesterday.   He said they are in Birmingham so they are trying to schedule all Huntsville appointments for the same day and MAYBE they would be able to get here next week.
I certainly understand when an employee is out sick that the the schedule has to be changed but I am disappointed in Allsouth that they did not contact me to let me know that my appt had been transferred to someone else AND that it would not occur today.  I took time off from work to be here and now will have to do it again for when they are able to come and make the repair.

text:
If I could give 0 stars I would!! Yes the staff are friendly, but everything they say is a lie. For starters they took my payment out 3 times and never gave me my money back so I was told that I didn't have to make my payment the next month since I showed bank statements proving they charged me 3 times well they charged my account again anyways. So now I have been charged 4 times for a washer and dryer that I've only had a month. I will be calling and having them come get it and demand my payments back. I would rather pay to go to a laundry mat than pay them $70 a month for a used washer and dryer it is so not worth it.
This is my first time renting anything and I will never do it again.
If you do rent from them use cash so they don't charge you like crazy and keep your money.

When your wife wakes you up at 2:00 in the morning and asks you if you hear water running, you know immediately it's not going to be fun. That's exactly what happened early this morning and the leak in the basement was in fact "not fun".
I turned the water off and first thing this morning called B & C. The lady who answered the phone was super nice. She set up an appointment and told me what time the plumber should arrive. Sure enough about 30 minutes prior to arrival the plumber gave me a ring to let me know what time he'd be here and he showed up right on schedule as promised.
He was very professional and we couldn't have been any happier with the work he did. We highly recommend B&C and I assure you we will use them again when we have plumbing needs.

name: David Solomon
text:
For this review, I feel I must first present a little information up front.
For the last several months I have been having issues with the plumbing in my house.  My house was built in 2007 with PVC pipe throughout.  Let’s just first say that after purchasing the home I later believed the plumbing was not installed to code, and first experienced several water leaks of which I fixed myself.

Several months ago I hired a plumber to come in and resolve a hot water (lack of) issue.  The Hot water tank had made an awful screeching noise similar to what I have been hearing in my modern GE Refrigerator with a water filter. At the time the plumber removed a check valve on the water Heater which resolved my Hot water problem and the screeching noise.  No further investigation was conducted on why the Hot water heater started having issues and I believe that repair cost me around $100.00.
So in the last couple of months I have still have that screeching with my Refrigerator and the pipes had been banging whenever we flushed one of the toilets.  Upon doing some research to try and resolve the banging pipe issues I had come across an article on a thermal expansion tank upstream from the Hot Water Heater on the Cold water line.  I located mine under the house just as the main cold water line comes in the house. The tank has a valve in it and is supposed to give a cushion for the water when it expands.  I went to check the expansion tank and when I put on an air tester, water came out, which is an indication of a faulty tank.  I purchased a new one and left the air pressure at the manufacture default and installed it.  Now my pipes started banging worse and the tank started making a sucking sound. I further researched the issue and found an article that too much water pressure can wreak havoc on your water system so I went to Lowe’s and picked up a cheap home water pressure gauge. I tested my system and found that my home was averaging around 130PSI. Based on this information resources indicated that a faulty Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) just up from the home water meter could be the culprit. I located mine by digging about a foot up from the local water meter and left it uncovered.
It was finally time for me to call a plumber as I am not one, and only completed the previous steps out of necessity.  I am a retired Enlisted Veteran and have not had a real job for six years and have been struggling to pay my bills.

The day before Christmas I called B & C Plumbing Inc. and left message on their phone system that I would be needing their services when they could work me in.  Tuesday after Christmas I received a courteous phone call from the B& C customer service and scheduled a Master Plumber to arrive at my home between 14:00 – 16:00. Shortly after that Drew the Master Plumber called me from his cell phone and said he was on his way over because he had a cancellation and would come and resolve the issue.

This is where the negative experience starts.  Drew arrived at my front door knowing the information that I had already shared previously and I shared that information with him again on what my issue was going on under the house.  His first statement to me before looking at anything was that it was going to cost me $300.00. No indication of a discount for anything or because I was a Military Vet.  Now first off, I expected that he would be crawling under my home and fix some of the issues with the bagging pipes (Non-Code meeting).  He had no time to give me a run down on what the problem was nor what it the cost layout was to fix my issues.

He proceeded to place a water pressure gauge on the outside faucet and recorded that the PSI was 145. He then went to the Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) and replaced it spending less than two hours of actual time far less work as much of the time was him on the Cell phone.

resp.text: Mr. Solomon, in response to your review I would like to apologize for your unsatisfactory experience with our company.  I would also like to state that we did not install the plumbing originally in your home in 2007.  We thank you for your comment about our courteous service manager calling and setting up your appointment.  We always offer an estimate for the cost of the repairs before any work is conducted, which you approved and paid for the work performed.   We do offer military, senior citizen, and all local law enforcement discounts, if we are informed ahead of time we can most certainly add that discount to your invoice.

name: Phyllis Cox
text: They are honest and reliable.

name: Krissi Harpel
text: All the reviews were great so I was excited to get started with this company.  Their representative came to the house and brought a contractor, I was told it would take about a week to generate an estimate of materials.  During that week I sent some colors I liked and a couple of questions and I was not getting any response from the designer .  Once the week was up I sent an email to the designer and told her I needed someone who was going to be responsive to emails .  She immediately responded saying that she could not get my cabinets to meet our timeline and I would have to find someone else ...which if she had paid attention I had asked for an estimate on painting and replacing .  I then left a message for someone from management. to call me and got no response.  Very very disappointing

resp.text: I spoke with Krissi and explained a few items to her concerning her project and attempted to assist her with her project even though Coastal is not performing the project.  Hopefully this will help.  We do not paint cabinets and recommend under normal conditions that this not be done.  Typically, a paint job will have to repeated in the near term due to underlying issues with cabinets themselves.

name: Hilton Perry
text: For many months my wife and I  have wanted to remodel our bath but finding some one that was knowledgeable and and responsive was impossible and had almost given up. A friend told us to call  Coastal Kitchen & Bath and with in just a few days we were set up to meet and go over what we wanted and measure. The next week we were picking out the flooring, cabinets and fixtures we wanted. Today we have the bath that we had visioned for moths. Very responsive and courteous.

resp.text: Thanks for the review.  It can be amazing what a kitchen remodel can do for the appearance of your home and your piece of mind.

name: Chelsie Sotero
text: I have had the pleasure of working with Jill here and she is a delight! This company should be proud to have her as an employee. She is very knowledgeable, helpful and very friendly. I will tell everyone I know to make sure to stop in!!!

resp.text: you're going to love your new mud room

name: me to you
text:
The lady, Jill, was very helpful.  If you go there you have to order what you see on display.  Ordering means a 3 or 4 week delay.  They have a variety of everything related to the bathroom.  My apologies because I did not take photos.

My contractor wants it yesterday. Seems the stuff is never there fast enough for them. They want to go to Lowe's, pick it up, and install it the same day.

resp.text: Thanks for the opportunity.  We do not keep cabinets in stock since there are so many options, sizes and colors.  Unfortunately, contractors can experience delays and then want everything yesterday, like you said.

name: Shawn Taylor
text: Great food

resp.text: Thanks for the great review on food...we'll take the 5 star review but don't serve food.  :)

name: Mike Tate
text: Everything turned out GREAT!  The few minor issues were promptly taken care of and the project was completed on time! Love it!

resp.text: Sometimes a kitchen remodel becomes an art and not a science but we stick with the job until you're happy.

name: Julie Bertolla
text: I had a fantastic experience with my recent remodel. Jill is very knowledgeable and went above and beyond to make sure I was happy.

resp.text: Great to hear.  I hope you enjoy your new cabinets and kitchen remodel

name: Michael Leserra
text: Great customer service

resp.text: Thanks for the review.  Hopefully we can assist with your kitchen remodeling project.

text: Awesome job on our kitchen counters! Defiantly recommend for quality work!

resp.text: you can't go wrong with granite counter tops, easy close cabinet doors and drawers and a tile back splash

text: Top notch service and quality.  They're certified designer was a great help

resp.text: Impact windows are a great replacement to protect against storms

name: Alla Nikitina
text: Out of business

resp.text: Actually, we are not out of business.  We have a new location that we are working on opening up after the Hurricane Sally destruction to our old building but we have been working from remote locations since Sally.  Our website, Facebook page, Pinterest, Google My Business page, etc. all reflect we are open for business and have been open for business.  Our phone number is active as well so feel free to contact us if you have a project you are interested in us quoting for you.  251-943-5358.

name: ted croft
text: They dont stand behind their products! Bought a marble vanity top and they installed two sinks (undermount) and the silicone bled through to the surface of the top and stained it where the silicone was applied for the sinks. The top is ruined! After sending pics Mike told me to call the manufacturer of the silicone to get it fixed or remedied. What terrible customer service. Good thing he sold the company!

resp.text: Ted is correct, the business has been sold to the owner of Folkers Window Company.  The marble vanity top Ted purchased was a old remnant from the warehouse and was "sold as is" for a very cheap price.  Unfortunately with remnants and very low prices, these things happen.  This was communicated to the customer at the time of the sale.  The best way to avoid issues with products and expired warranties is to purchase new products instead of remnants.

name: Anisha Penton
text: Amazing company to work with! Very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff.

resp.text: Great choice with Silestone quartz counter tops

name: Gayle Patterson
text: Jill Kinard is very knowledgeable and helpful.

resp.text: Thanks much.  Hopefully we can assist with your remodeling project

name: Cheryl McCoy
text: Good products, pricey

resp.text: Thanks for the business and the review.  No, we are not the cheapest because as you said "good products".  We do not sell junk and we use professional installers and not sub contractors.  In addition, we use stainless steel fasteners, high grade caulks, etc. all which lead to a higher price and a higher quality installation.  Thus, we will typically not be the cheapest...but we're the best.

name: Rebecca Parks
text: Very nice people at Browns.I had a question about my stove they explained my question and told me what was wrong with it. Gave me the part told me how to put it on. It works now. I highly recommend Brown's Hardware for all of your home and farm needs.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review, and the 5 star, Tana. We are happy that your experience has been a positive one. ^Rent A Center Digital Care Team

name: Amanda Brunner
text: The appliances I got over a year ago are wonderful and I’ve never had an issues with them. The real problem is the staff at this location. They were SO beyond nice when I first went in to pick out my things, but as soon as the first few payments were due they started hounding us. Days before the payments were due or the morning of, not even giving us enough time to get off work and make the payments!! They would call and be so rude over the phone. If we had to call for anything they were rude. We had to set up auto draft so they’d stop hounding us. We made a payment online so we wouldn’t have to deal with their attitudes & they charged us for that online payment, plus took money in auto draft. When I called to see about getting my money back they said they couldn’t do anything for me. I do not recommend this store, simply because of how poorly they treat customers. I work retail & I know how it is, but these people are straight up awful.

resp.text: Hi, I am so sorry for the delay. We have had an influx of service calls lately and unfortunately it’s taking us longer to work through them now because of the extra precautions we are taking due to the virus.

name: Shanquille Finch
text: Needed a refrigerator so found this place on line. When my daughter and I walked in the man was on the phone didn’t give us a hand sign or anything, got up and walked out of the room to the back room. If I could have given no stars I would have. Very, very rude and apparently didn’t need my money. I did look however for a second, priced are SKY HIGH! DO NOT recommend this place to anyone!

resp.text:
I would like to apologize for your experience. That is certainly not typical. We are a local family business and always strive to treat everyone as we would want to be treated. As for the prices, I’ve double checked all the prices we have on refrigerator s and most of them are fairly competitive for the particular models. There was one model that was mis-priced and has been adjusted accordingly and we thank you for bringing that to our attention. Again I’m sorry for what happened in your case and hope you will give us another chance in the future.
Thanks, Josh

name: Kayla Mcmahon
text: This is an awful place to do business!!!!!!! My dad left his phone in the business. They answered my Dad's phone and it was his brother in law! They told them where it was and then when my dad went to get the phone it was gone and apparently someone picked it up. Well let me just say this, you never give anyone else’s phone to someone else regardless of who they claim to be! You are lucky because it was my dad’s brother in law. But the fact you just let someone have his phone without even confirming is a huge red flag!!!!!!!!! My dad had absolutely no knowledge of you giving his phone to someone else, until he made an appearance to pick his phone up from your store! I would have made a police report and there would have been a huge problem for your business had this not turned out well!! You need to seriously address your staff and correct this immediately!

resp.text: HI Kayla Mcmahon, Thank you for sharing your feedback about your experience with your local Aaron's store. We are sorry to hear that you did not receive the service that you deserve from your local store. We will forward your concerns to our Divisional Management Team to investigate further. name: Brigette Bridges
text: I purchased a recliner from Arrons, paid it out recently. I had also leased a refrigerator from the for a few months in 2017. They offered me a deal if there was anything else I needed so I decided I would get another refrigerator to keep this time. When they brought it ought they asked if I had someone here to move my existing fridge. I said no, y'all moved my old one last time. The manager says "Well they are not supposed to and we will not move it today". So I had to tell them to take the fridge back. They should let you know ahead of time if you have a fridge there that you will have to arrange for it to be moved before they come out!!!  I found another place to get a fridge.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear this, and thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will look further look into this issue for you. If you have any additional information, please email us at myexperience@aarons.com. Thanks -- Phil

(I heard the tape) If he ever talks to my wife like that again well... that's another story. It is never okay to be in a hostile work inviroment. She works her butt off for that place, has hurt herself for that place, and the store has actually done much better with her being there. She's happy go lucky, peace, love, and make that money. Why treat employees this way? Thumbs down for the bitter old employee who should be at home with his dog watching "Murder she Wrote" popping his pills. Next time Mr.Mike take your issues out on someone else. NOT MY WIFE.

Had it not been for their willingness to take the time to check for me I would not have been able to get the appliance I had been searching for! Kudos to Badcock for having excellent customer service. My experience and transaction with Shawn at the Thomasville store was flawless! Class act!!!

I put him in my recliner which I purchased from badcocks but different make and he’s more comfortable and the pain lessened.
I’m wondering what your policy is for replacing this chair. I’m a faithful Babcock customer and would like to continue to be.
Thank you and God Bless!

text: Love Badcocks and the people that work in the Thomasville, Al store, but when we sent in our payment we accidentally sent one dollar short. Just an oversight on our part. Seems to me that someone in tthat store would have sacrificed one dollar to save us a long trip. I know I would certainly have done that for my good customers. We would have certainly paid them back when we had to go to town. Sigh.... just saying. 😪

resp.text: Hi, Faye. We're so sorry to hear you had to drive the unexpected 25 miles. While we hope you don't have to encounter this again, we want to make you aware of other payment options that might be more convenient. We recommend trying our online payment service, pay-by-phone automated line, or simply calling our credit team at 1-877-706-8959. Thank you for being our loyal customer. We appreciate YOU!

text: I went into the Helena, AL store and Marcus was really helpful by assisting me with finding exactly what I  was searching for. He also helped me pick out accessories to compliment my sofa and chair. If you are searching for furniture at a reasonable price, go see Marcus in Helena.

text: Walked in to get my son a bed and mattress, this was not my first time purchasing from A F. I also have my king size bedroom set from them. Excellent customer service, very friendly staff and fast service. Thank you American Freight in Helena.

name: KRISSY HIGGINS
text: I ordered furniture at Helena store around end of April 2021. Told furniture would be in May 28. Well May 28 and no furniture. They told me truck does not even deliver until June 9. Finally got order a few days after and it was missing a dresser. I was told it is in Tuscaloosa by mistake. They will go get it. When I get home 1 dresser is damaged. I send pictures to email per Marcus requested. 2 weeks later still no missing dresser or reply about damaged dresser. They tell me that the Forest dale store location has 2 dressers I can go there and get them and bring damage dresser to them. Chasity at Forest dale store is amazing. She was a great help to get this taken care of for me. Although when I get home 1 of the 2 dressers is damaged. Now what? Guess I have to figure how to make defective dresser be ok. I'm not driving a hour back over there for more defective furniture. Never settle for the cheaper price. My granny always said you pay for what you get..

resp.text: We apologize for any inconvenience. Please reach out to the Store Manager at 205-624-4444 to discuss  your experience.

name: Gwendolyn Ivy
text: I purchased a sectional for my den and sofa and love seat for my living room. All pieces were supposed to be delivered on 6/19/2021. I was quoted a delivery fee of 175 because it was coming from Tuscaloosa. Well due to the weather, I received a call at 7pm stating my sectional would be delivered between 12-6on 6/20/2021. When I required about my sofa and loveseat...it's not on this delivery. I was informed I would have to pay another delivery fee for something I had no control over. I have been calling the Helena store since 7:02pm and the line has been busy. I am beyond upset and I am not happy.

resp.text: We apologize for any inconvenience. Please reach out to the Store Manager at 205-624-4444 to discuss your experience.

text: Great, friendly service and I'm always immediately greeted as I come through the door! Everyone is very helpful, and the prices are well worth it. Will definitely make them my go-to :)

He is extremely knowledgeable on all of the products offered and answered all of my questions thoroughly. I was able to get everything I needed quickly and easily. I will definitely return in the future.

name: Jacinta Brock
text: Marcus is the absolute best. I came in to the store with an idea of what I wanted. He lead me in the right direction. He even got all of my items deliverd the same day before closing. Best customer service. I will continue to use him for all my furniture needs.

name: Jason Ford
text: Service was great, until they got my signature on everything. We were ASSURED that they can get it on the car and make sure that it wasn't going to move...AT ALL. After I signed for everything, everyone walked away. I had to ask for help to put the mattress on the car and then had to tie it down by myself. Not sure that we will be back for a second experience at this place. Honesty goes a VERY long way with me.

resp.text: Hello Jason, we are sorry to hear about your recent shopping experience. Input about our stores and employees helps improve customer satisfaction and we aim to please. Please call (740)833-6396 so we can put you in direct contact with the Regional Manager of the store location you recently visited. Thank you.

text: Customer service is great...add that with the selection and prices and this place is hard to beat.

name: Steven Knestrict
text:
BUYER BEWARE: When purchasing love seat and sofa a year ago we were told that the additional $100 protection plan would cover these couches for 5 years of ANY accidents (rips, tears, stains, from kids dogs, cats etc.) And that if any occur our living room set would be replaced. This was the main reason we purchased from this company.
1 1/2 years later we find out that none of these things are actually covered under the plan.

We feel we were intentionally misled into paying for a useless service.

text:
I been a customer every since 2019. Back when Cory and delivery man Lorenzo was there. No problems. My husband purchased the Raspberry Bedroom set. He asked Marcus for the complete set. Marcus was too busy inquiring who my husband was buying the bedroom suit for. That he didn't disclose the set only includes one nightstand. Usually a Queen size bed set has two parties. My husband spent $1,333.16, plus $200.00 for delivery. Just to find out there's only one nightstand.  I called Darnell who accuses me of yelling and I can't fix it, if you don't stop. All bets were off when he made the comment that my husband and I should have looked online.  To see what the order details. Voices on both sides got loud, and Darnell laughs and hangs up. So, if you go to a restaurant, you should already know what's on the menu.  I will not be back and I'm telling my family members who shop here too. Don't!!

Just want to inform the Regional Manager that a paid in full Bedroom Set and Set up, plus tip. A paid in full order that was supposed to be delivered all on Tuesday. The Chess part that they didn't have Tuesday 06/30/2020, and MARCUS said would come Wednesday 07/01/2020, the deliveryman told us 8:30p.m. he was still coming. Only not too show up. And my husband and I didn't get to bed until 12:00a.m., and husband had to be at work 5:00 a.m. the next morning. So, we are going on the third day 07/02/2020, waiting on our $200.00 Raspberry chest, just to call all day. The deliverymen arrived 11:20 p.m., threw the chess down, that was paid to be assembled and left. Need I say more.

As of yesterday, he still could not give me an update on the status of my living room furniture. I finally spoke with the manager who was unaware of this situation and told me that my complaint was one of many and that Marcus had been demoted. However, this doesn't change the fact that I've been in my house for almost a month with no living room furniture and they've had the payment in full long before I even closed on my house. DON'T ORDER ANYTHING FROM HERE!

name: Adam Huddleston
text:
We bought a new sofa/loveseat combo from them. The pricetag was certainly lower than anywhere else we looked, and it looked like OK quality furniture.
Less than 3 weeks after purchase, the sofa literally fell apart. We're pretty normal sized people and have treated it with care. I turned it over and opened up the upholstery to have a look.  The construction quality is the worst I've ever seen; low grade partical board, half-rotted knotty 1/2" thick pine, and the whole thing is held together with staples.  I identified 6 separate joints that had come apart inside the couch due to the staples simply slipping out of the wood, and many more that were halfway undone.
I ended up taking around 3 or 4 hours and meticulously replacing pieces, reinforcing joints with metal brackets and screws, and closing up places in the upholstery which were mysteriously split and leaking stuffing.

The furniture here is truly of the lowest quality, even if it appears fine on the surface.  If you buy from here, make sure you also purchase their ridiculously expensive warranty (that will tack on $100 - $200 to your purchase), because you're gonna be needing it a whole lot.  If you need cheap furniture, go to the thrift store or use Facebook marketplace. If you want new furniture, spring for something more expensive.

name: Givon Wayne Gilliam
text:
We bought a floor model and learned a valuable lesson. The couch with chase looked great on the showroom floor and we were very excited to get what we thought was a good deal.

In less than a year the cushions started to shred.  We do not have children and very few guests.  We are very gentle on our furniture.   To our dismay and surprise the couch covering started to disintegrate before our very eyes.   The middle cushion does not even get used at all and it was the first one to split and fray. See photo for what your couch will look like if you buy it from American Freight.

We took the cushions into the store thinking they would honor a 1 year warranty.  Unfortunately because the couch was a floor model it was an “as-is”purchase  and we were out of luck.  American Freight said that there was nothing that they could do.

Here is a warning for you.  If you decide to purchase a floor model, do not be surprised if it does not last one year.  You are buying disposable furniture.  Lesson learned.
