name: Amy Thompson
text:
Bought (and financed) two matching recliners on July 21st of 2018. The Helena store only had one so we picked up the other from the Trussville location. Get home to find the Trussville store had given us a broken chair. We return it to the Helena store a few days later and were told they would have to order it and it could take up to 3 weeks to receive the replacement.
We have been very patient, probably to patient...Because here we are 5 months later paying on a chair/recliner that we don't have!
Through these past 5 months there have been countless attempts to reach out to the Helena location, only to be blown off by staff that insist they are oblivious to what is going on and leave me with, "I will have to call you back."
Never to be heard from again until the next time I call or reach out via the American freight website.
This situation has gone on entirely long enough! I personally do not suggest doing business with this company and if you so choose to, just remember, "buyer beware!"

name: Christine Horst
text: I'm giving one star on this review because Harrell Appliance did fix one issue with my washing machine.  I first contacted them on March 15 to fix the gasket seal on my front loading GE Washer.  The repair man did show up the next evening to fix the gasket seal, but also noticed there was a part missing.  He said he would order the part and let me know when it came in so he could finish repairing the washing machine.  I heard nothing from Harrell from March 16 until March 23.  Never once was I contacted about the part coming in, or when he would finish fixing my washer.  I would check back in with Harrell every couple of weeks with phone calls and texts.  Finally on May 8, he told me my part was in, and that it had been on back order (for over a month) and he would try to get to my place to finish the washer.  Two weeks later I called him from my phone to see when he was coming and he did not answer.  I then called him from my work phone, and he answered.  He said for the second time he was on his way to pick up my part and he would try to make it to my house the next day.  That was sometime in June.  It is now August 4.  I've received no further phone calls or texts from Harrell.  I texted twice with no reply.  I tried to call - no answer.  This is terrible service.  I absolutely would not recommend Harrell Appliance to anyone!  I pointedly asked several times if I should go somewhere else, and he assured me he would finish the work.  I'm pretty confident I was lied to the entire time, and am doubtful that a part was ever ordered.

text: I thought he was great at first! Thought he fixed it, said he'd be back the next day, no show! Then he said he'd be back on saturday morning between 9-10,once again,no show, wouldn't answer his phone or text! In Monday night, the following week i text him, asked" why didn't you come back" and hour later he sends back "tommorrow" I was like naw! I already got someone else! He says he'd be happy to make right whatever was wrong, I said I'd really like to have my money back, since it wasnt fixed and you never came back, he said we will talk tommorrow, Its tommorrow, I have heard nothing! So disappointed! The one star is because it's the only way I can post this!🤨

text: Seems like a nice guy but he never finished the job. He kept telling me he'd come back but never did.

text: Came to fix a part on the washer which still wasn't completely fixed then came to look at stove he claimed  he could fix he just had to order the part for it. Dexter never once returned a call that I made to him. Went above and beyond to get a one star review!

text: Great service ! Came out within an hour of calling him on a Saturday to fix my dryer .

text: Great service , very nice gentleman, came right out, fixed my fridge, and was very fair price. I would recommend him to anyone. Thank you so much sir, it was a pleasure

text: He was very convenient, nice and worked very quickly to fix my washer! I would definitely refer anyone to him who needed a appliance repair!

name: Yetta Ewing
text: Pleasure to deal with.  Service was quick and he got to the repair in the same day.  This was actually the second time I have used this company for a repair.  Used the same company about a year ago for an unrelated repair.

name: Jane Reeves
text: I contacted Dexter Wednesday evening in regards to the commercial stove in the kitchen at camp where I cook. We were having issues with it arcing and tripping the breaker when we flipped the breaker on. He showed up at 9:30 Thursday morning and worked on it until 4:00 until he was sure there were no more issues and ensured that I would be able to cook for our camp that starts Friday! I’m sure any other repairman would have given up and said it wasn’t worth the time and effort to get it working again; but he stuck it out until he got it working safely again. We appreciate his hard work and effort. And his charge was extremely reasonable. I totally recommend his services.

name: Michelle Forcier
text: He didn't come back to finish the job, after he took dryer apart,,,said he didn't have time .  What's up with that.

name: Matthew Towns
text: He was extremely polite. Service was quick and reasonably priced. Knowledgeable and very obviously good at what he does.

name: yoyen lau
text: “Fixed” my washing machine for $120. Thirty days later, same problem. Called several times for a week, appts continued to get postponed for later times or later day in the week. VM is now full and no answer to my texts. Still has not shown up and probably never will.

name: jcrow1722
text: We've used Dexter twice to fix our dryer last year, and the washer this year.  Both times were great experiences.  He worked well around our schedule and was quick with the repairs at competitive pricing.  I highly recommend.

name: Dennis Vines
text:
I've been trying to get my ice maker repaired since November of last year through my sear's home warranty, but they couldn't get it fixed. I called Harrell-appliances and they had it fixed in 30 minutes and it's been running great . They are professional, very friendly and courteous. They are always available to take your call (an actual live person) which is very refreshing. They even called me back to make sure that the ice maker was still working. If I ever have any more problems with my appliances, they are the one's I will call, and you should do .
Thank you soooooooo much .

name: twnica newton
text: Was called to service my microwave oven but didn't show up! Sears set this appointment up through my Sears Warranty! He denies having such appointments! I called him and my dad called him! The appointment was set up on 3/28/18! Sears wanted me to call him back out but I refuse to beg anyone to come to do a job! I will wait and call someone else who is available! Very unprofessional!!!

name: Ryan Yates
text: I've been dealing with another business in town for 3 weeks trying to get my mother's dryer fixed. After giving up on them ever showing up, I found Harrell Appliance Repair and called this afternoon. Not only did he make time to come diagnose the dryer the same day, but he also fixed it the first trip. He was very kind, professional, and very fair priced. I highly recommend anyone who has a problem to call this business,

name: Brandy Whitt
text: Our fridge wasn't getting cool. He came out 3 times with 3 different diagnoses and it took 2 1/2 months for the fridge to Still not work. He won't answer our calls and won't call is back! Waste of time and money.

name: Ed Paul
text: Terrible Experience!   Had him over to fix my ice maker that was froze up, and he took a heat gun to de-ice.  Put everything back together, and then NEVER showed up to repair it.  Month later, froze up again, and I went to chip away the ice, and found this hole!  thought I chipped something at first, and then, after closer inspection, found there was no chipped piece, but that it was melted.  Yes, he melted the ice maker with his heat gun, never told us, and then never showed back up after getting his money.  STAY AWAY.

name: S Wyatt
text: Answered call 1st time. Was in Bham but offered to come that evening.  Next morning my schedule changed so I texted Dexter  (he was the one who answered yesterday).  Barely left msg & number when he called back. Was here in 10 min. Repaired my washer quickly and efficiently.  Extremely reasonably priced. Polite, professional, and I will be using them again for other appliance repairs when time permits.  Thank you for proving the negative remarks absolutely WRONG !  Sissy Overstreet here.

name: Grayson
text: No follow through. Unreliable. I needed an ice maker replacement and he said he ordered it. However, every time I contacted him he kept saying it hadn't been delivered. Then, he said delivery was two weeks ago and he would install that afternoon. Never heard from him again. No respect.

name: Lucy Hodnett
text: Worst service ever!  Called first thing on Monday morning needing freezer repair.  He said he would be out the same day.  Never showed.  I called him Monday afternoon at 4:11pm and he said he would be at my house within the hour.  NEVER SHOWED!!  It is now 1:45pm on Tuesday and I still haven't heard from him.  Do not use this man.  He is unreliable and dishonest.

name: Scott Crane
text: Worst Service I've ever experience.  Had a service repair scheduled, and the guy NEVER showed up.  Called him, and he said he would come that following Monday.  Never showed up.  Comes on Tuesday, and ordered a part.  It's been two weeks, and never heard from him.  Call (doesn't answer), and I finally get a hold of him later that day, and he says he will come "tomorrow".  My wife waits around ALL-DAY and he doesn't call, and doesn't show up.  I call the following Monday, and he says he will come tomorrow.  I asked him why he didn't show up on Friday, and he says that's "Water Under the Bridge".   He then says....I really don't want to deal with this.  TERRIBLE SERVICE.  Booked through Sears

name: Michelle Owen
text: They advertise 24 months with no interest.  My husband and I picked out furniture.  We were approved for 5000 dollars.  But only 12 months no interest. We couldn’t get the 24.   If we were approved for that much why was it only for 12 months?  Our payments were gonna be over 300 dollars a month.  When we asked how much it would be with interest it was gonna be over 200 a month for 24 months.  We figured up the stuff we wanted was 3600 dollars. After paying for 2 years we would pay over 5000 dollars. Way too much interest.  They use the 24 months no interest to get you in the door then tell you you can’t get it.  Then you have to pay a lot of interest.  I guess they think if you are already in there you will go ahead and pay with interest. False advertising.  We went somewhere else and got the same amount of furniture for 128 dollars a month.

name: Michael Battle
text:
The service at the oxford Alabama branch sucks!!! The manager of the store is very RUDE and disrespectful to the employees. And the customers receive the same treatment.

I have never been insulted and treated so poorly. 1st....they attempted to deliver my furniture incomplete. Was going to deliver and setup the entire bedroom and make me wait 2-3 days for my mattress. Whoever heard of such a thing? If we didn’t call the day before, they would’ve done it.
2nd...the delivery was not on time and the decided to send ya a loaner mattess but instructed us to not remove the plastic and expect us to sleep on crunching plastic for 2-3 days. NOT ACCEPTABLE! 3rd....They delivered my furniture late and it was not installed and setup properly.

Their solution was a HUGE insult!!! $99 credit!!

When we called to discuss with manager, he kept passing comments and words through a sales rep and not wanting to come to phone to talk with an upset customer.

Additionally, we were told we should receive a call in a couple days from a manager that never occurred. After 3 days, we contacted corporate with same results. They told us that they will forward to a district manager and they will call us in a couple days.

This place is HORRIBLE!!! I will NEVER recommend or shop at the Oxford Alabama Branch ever again. I would pay more at another store/furniture place before going back to this store!!! If I could give negative stars, I would!!!

resp.text: Hi, Michael. We're so sorry to hear you were dissatisfied with your experience. Please know your information was shared with the District Manager as promised. Bottom line....If you're looking for an appliance,  please trust these folks with your business. They have been honorable and accommodating and they have a HUGE selection to choose from !

name: Joseph Gray
text:
TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE.

So far the savings have not been worth the trouble.
I found them on facebook marketplace, and asked for a specific dryer listed as available.  I asked them to reserve that dryer.  Not long before I wanted it to be delivered they said someone came and bought it.  I asked for something comparable and got three blurry images to choose from.  I picked one out of the three and it was delivered for a fee.
A few days ago I bought a dryer from them.  The next day my tenants informed me that it was not working.  I messaged them immediately and was notified that the office was closed and would re-open in the morning.    After speaking with someone about this he said he'd come the next day at 1:30pm.  It is well past 1:30 now, and I have not even been able to get in touch with them.  I am unsatisfied with every bit of this transaction.
It has been several days since I first saw the original dryer I asked for which was "sold". It is still listed as available ( I find that suspicious).
UPDATE: They came out today to repair the dryer, my tenant just called and said it has already broken again.
UPDATE 2: I am appalled at the unprofessional manner in which this company has conducted itself.
I’ve asked for them to remove the dryer from my property and for a full refund. They said they would be at the house at 4:00pm, then no one showed up. I had a tenant stay at the house for them, and he said he waited an hour and fifteen minutes before he had to leave. This is unacceptable.

text: I just waited a week for a dinner table because it had to be ordered and then delivered. name: Faye Ahzburjn
text: We did business for years with Farmers Furniture and always had great experiences. When our family moved to the Huntsville area we had to have our account transferred so we could make payments in store locally, since they have no online payment system. We have been harrassed and called nonstop, back to back, each month as soon as the due date nears. When we mention this to them, they reply that its company policy. No it isnt. text: We hired this company to remodel our kitchen. We did not have much knowledge about these types of projects, so we really needed someone who could provide us with insight and direction. After having looked around before hiring them, I feel confident that there is no other kitchen remodel company in the state that is even close on service, price or quality.

text: I normally do not leave lengthy reviews but I've really noticed a considerable change over the last year regarding customer service, management, and my overall shopping experience. I have purchased the majority of my home's furnishings and appliances just over the last six months alone as I have been remodeling. Your Sales Manager, Nicholas, is warm and inviting. He has gone above and beyond to meet and exceed my needs (from helping to select the right colors and fabrics of my furnishings to match and contrast properly down to suggesting the Porter Cable tools for my many DIY projects), and has even made this whole remodeling process much easier. He has truly made me feel like family as I know I am welcome to contact him at any time with my many questions. Both Katie, the store manager, and Nicholas are huge assets to Rent-A-Center, imho. Anyhow, had these changes not occurred you all would have lost me as a customer due to the previous management., so kudos to you for stepping up! In addition,  they have been incredibly helpful and supportive during the current pandemic of COVID-19. So, if anyone has had a bad experience in the past, go see Nicholas and Katie. I do believe you will be pleasantly surprised.

text: I have been doing business with this rent a center for YEARS and I have always had a wonderful experience. The customer service is spot on and they are ALWAYS there to help.

name: Samantha Parks
text: I am a first time customer of Rent a Center. This will also be my last time. I will NEVER do business with these people again. I came in looking for a playstation. To begin with they were great. They said no problem and brought me out a 500 GB playstation. I got it home and....well let's just say it IMMEDIATELY went back. It came with FREE bugs. They told me it would be a few days before they would be able to get me another. So I waited. Finally they called and said they had a brand new one in. I went to pick it up and turns out it was brand new but it had more storage. They said that the whole thing was their fault so they wouldnt charge me anymore and gave me an extra controller. Turns out THEY LIED! BECAUSE THEY GAVE ME A PS4 FILLED WITH BUGS, THEY CHARGED ME FOR THE EXTRA SPACE AND THE EXTRA CONTROLLER THEY TOLD ME WOULDNT COST ME ANY EXTRA! So at this point I'm already aggravated. It gets much worse. I'm standing in line to pay one day, and the 2 customer reps were speaking to each other. The one lady said "Weve got people that haven't paid  in almost 4 weeks. If they would just pay on time we wouldnt have to go repossess their things". Okay no big deal. Every now and then I get a week behind. BUT I ALWAYS CALL AND LET THEM KNOW AND I ALWAYS PAY FOR 2 WEEKS PLUS THE EXTRA FEES THEY TAK ON!!!! ALWAYS! The most recent week I was 5 days late. I called them and told them. And they had the audacity to tell me they would have to come and take it if I didn't come pay it within 2 days. I ONLY HAVE 100$ LEFT AND YOUVE GOT PEOPLE THAT ARE 4 WEEKS LATE AND YOURE GOING TO COME TAKE MY PLAYSTATION THAT I HAD TO WAIT AN ENTIRE WEEK ON BECAUSE OF YOUR MESS UP!!!! YOU ADD EXTRA FEES!!!! YOU LIED AND MADE ME PAY MORE BECAUSE OF YOUR MISTAKE!!!! I told my mother and sister in Law yall were great to go get Washer and Dryers and TVs from. I gave yall business and this is how I get treated? When I pay the playstation off I will NOT be getting my Sofa from you. I will go to Aaron's and NEVER BE back. I will tell my mother and Sister and Law to go to Aarons. I will review you on every social media account I can because of how you treated me. My email is parks.samantha1031@gmail.  Fix this and I will gladly change my review. My Playsation should have been FREE for the mess you made. I've never in my LIFE! I expect an email or a phone call to fix this. Then again it's looking like money comes before customers.

resp.text: We take pride in our product hygiene and cleanliness, Samantha. We have very strict cleanliness standards for all of our products. We retain professional relationships with third party vendors to scrutinize our best practices, and support our continued efforts in maintaining product integrity. Your feedback is important to the RAC experience, and I have escalated the opportunity to your District Manager, Robert. Our Digital Care team is unable to locate your Customer agreement in our systems to reach out. Could you please contact our Solution Center at 1-800-422-8186 to activate the best RAC support? name: Shirley Martin
text: Customer Service the worst.  Constantly had to call them to get status.  Ordered appliances in Sept 2020, took three times to get microware installed, then it was the wrong trim kit, so install was not complete.  Out of a cost of the trim kit and install ($300), after 4 calls Siano only offered a $25 refund, which was unacceptable.  So Siano kept the trim kit (which they use for someone else), and we have an unfinished install.   Always like to buy local, but will never use them again.

name: Vicki Burns
text: We had just moved and picked up a refrigerator, washer and dryer. Walked the floor, learned all we needed to know to make the right choice for us and it was delivered 2 days later! They're very accommodating!

name: Amy Johnson
text: If I could give Siano's zero stars, I would. I bought a speed queen washer/dryer set from them in late September which cost me over $2000.  It would take several weeks for delivery so they set me up with a third party guy they use. On the day of the delivery the delivery guy called me several times to keep me updated on his schedule. At 3 he said he was on his way to pick it up and bring the set to me. At 3:15 the salesman from Siano's called me and said there was a piece missing (a lid lock) on the washing machine and it wouldn't work until they could get a new one. I asked if the delivery guy (who was older, rented a u-haul and had been keeping me updated all day) would get paid if I canceled the order. The salesman said " No Mam"!  I would have canceled but felt responsible for wasting the delivery guys time and money (obviously the salesman did not). It really bothered me that he called me at 3:15! It was delivered and took another week until I could use it. Now the most frustrating part, from the beginning the dryer gave me trouble. It wouldn't dry the load 100 percent (towels 55 percent, clothes 85 percent, etc.). I kept changing settings thinking I was doing something wrong. I finally called them and the repair guy came out felt the dryer and said there is plenty of heat. He told me to get my vents cleaned out, test some loads without it being attached to the vent. So I did all this and had my husband do different loads on different settings, etc. This cost us time and money. I had to get my vents cleaned out. My electric bill was $600 (not all the dryer but some). Finally it still didn't work and they decided to replace a part. Now it works. They sold me a broken washer and dryer and I spent a lot of time and money figuring that out.

The sales person was very knowledgeable, and his comments confirmed all the research I had already done, so I didn't feel like I was being taken for a ride. The delivery was next day, weeks faster than some other appliance stores in town. The delivery guys were friendly, and even came back super quick to replace one of the hoses that was bad. name: Sharon Geiger
text: Don't buy from them!  I purchased a Speed Queen washing machine for $817 plus, from this store in January 2015 (Love this washer btw).  After a month or so, it got very loud & I started noticing a black "dust" from beneath.  This became progressively worse & I contacted the Huntsville store where I purchased it.  They told me they don't service my area.  I explained that this is a warranty issue, since I hadn't even had it 6 months.  The Manager, Jerum, agreed but said there was nothing they could do because they lost the service tech they had for my area & to call someone else & then get back with him with what they said.  I got Bob Wallace Appliance to come out.  Service guy found that the belt mechanism was messed up & caused the belts to get shredded. In addition... while the front panel was removed, noticed the wash drum had begun to rust significantly.  This was all pretty surprising to him & to me because honestly, Speed Queen washers are beasts!  Incredible cleaning in short cycles... highly recommend.  So this was just a fluke & I didn't lose faith in the brand.  I call the manager Jerum back & tell him the news.  He asks me to send him a picture of the report along with pics of the washer that I took, to his cell phone.  I think he said his email was not working that day. I sent everything.  Jerum called me back pretty quickly & said that the washer was on back order for over a month.  But as soon as he could get one in, he would swap it out.  I explained that I have kids, grandkids & a lot of laundry & can't go that long without a washer.  Jerum told me to go ahead & let Bob Wallace Appliance fix the washer enough to get it working so I would have something to use while we waited on the back order.  I agreed to this but was nervous about getting screwed.  So I followed up after getting off the phone with him by texting to the number he had given me.  I said... just to make sure there was no misunderstanding & reiterated the agreement.  He replied that yes, that was the agreement. I called Bob Wallace  back & the same tech came out & replaced the belt assembly.  I did have several weeks without a washing machine.  I waited about a week after when I was told that my new washer would arrive to call.  Jerum said they were still back ordered.  This went on with me calling & being told that it was still back ordered until November when I contacted Speed Queen myself to see if Jerum was lying.  SQ said they were behind in keeping up with the demand but that they would send one right away if the manager contacted them.  I sent the Manager a text at the end of November saying that my patience had run out & if I didn't have my new machine asap, that I was going to court.  I received a reply saying that he no longer worked there & to contact the new manager!!  I called the store & spoke with a manager named Seth.  Very nice guy, very apologetic.  He said they were left cleaning up many of Jerum's messes.  Said he would get my machine swapped out right away.  I was so relieved.  Until he called back to say that he had spoken to the main office & they were not going to replace my machine & if I had anything else to discuss that I should call a manager named Chris.  I call Chris.  This guy was unbelievably rude & actually said that they don't even make my machine anymore & I was just making up a story to get a new washer & they didn't have record of my having bought anything from their store.  I was livid!  I told him that I would be happy to take my proof of purchase along with all of my proof of the "agreement" with their previous manager to court & that it was beyond unprofessional the way any of this was handled. That's when he said to send him all of my proof via email & if I did that, then they would replace the washer.  I did & they didnt! Ultimately I threatened & got a refund but there is more to the nightmare.  Unfortunately the space for this review has maxed out.  Happy to provide proof of everything to anyone!

BTW, I just read that Sears has filed for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy.
10/22 - Purchased a Kitchenaid dishwasher and it was installed the same day. Installers were awesome, taking care to answer our concerns during the process.  Well done.!!!
10/29 - Purchased an oven. It will be delivered and installed in about 10 days.

name: Caleb Whitson
text:
Went into the store trying to buy a replacement thermostat for my Maytag Neptune dryer. I didn't know the exact part number for the brand, but I did know the equivalent Samsung part number that was interchangeable. The gentleman who helped me was very nice and helpful. I have no complaints with him.
The older lady who was there interjected herself into our conversation is a different matter though. She very rudely and told me that we couldn't use an equivalent part from a different brand, and completely took over the conversation. I pointed out that it was standard practice to have interchangeable parts, but she went on about how she had been doing this business for 20+ years and knew what she was talking about. She then offered to sell me a Maytag specific thermostat package for around $40. I ended up buying the Samsung thermostat for $8 on Amazon and installed it myself. My Maytag dryer now works like new with a Samsung thermostat. I'm sure the rest of the staff is very nice and helpful, but the older lady was rude, condescending, and worst of all, completely clueless about appliance repair.

text: Poor customer service is absolutely inexcusable  in a sales-driven industry.  We came into this store yesterday afternoon (door chime was functional). We had done  our research online and were ready to purchase complete living room, dining room, and mattress sets. We were in the store at least 20 minutes identifying the items we had chosen.  NOT ONE salesperson came out to greet or assist us so we left and went home to do more online research.  Corporate should definitely be made aware of this behavior. Today we went to Badcock and bought all the items on our list. Lauren and all staff members were friendly and professional. Cost more, but peace of mind is priceless.

text: Predatory lenders...read the contracts very carefully.. predatory interest rates make it difficult to pay down balance. They aren't doing you a favor, they are taking advantage. You should decline coverage and save yourself money. They refuse to fix it if it breaks even if you have insurance. They literally stalk you like predators! They show up at your home unannounced if you’re late on a payment. Then talk to you like a dog. Uncaring, unprofessional, rude, & demeaning. text:
If you’re looking to finance furniture or anything in that sorts go to another furniture store and do it. Some place else’s furniture will be made better and I bet their customers service is so much better also.

They have deleted my other review about things being fixed from previously. The manager at the time did fix the problem. But I made a stupid mistake by buying something else that was more exspensive thinking it would be better, now they don’t want to fix that again a few months back. On top of that I completely forgot to come in and make November’s payments (normally someone would call me between the 1st and 10th just to remind me)(I’m a mother of two and full time college student so I’m forgetful when I don’t get reminders) they called me last week while I was sitting in class so I asked them to call me back in a couple of hours to discuss why they had called. Didn’t think nothing of it. Well today I got a letter in the mail saying I was avoiding them and refusing their calls (which I have not I answer every phone calll that comes in because I never know if something might have happened to someone) then the “new manager” tried to say she delivered this letter to my house today. This letter has a stamp on it has been through the post office lines and was in my mailbox at the bottom of the box(I haven’t checked my mail in three days so it was full) but she proceeds to tell me that my account which as of today is 30days late it wasn’t 30days late when she sent this letter to me. That she would be sending it to the court house this week. And that she would not work with me because I’m 30days late as of today. That this was policy after 30 days. I worked at this store in 2017 for a while and they normally don’t send to collection until 120 days or later. She also tried to tell me they have been calling I have not received but that one call from them a little over a week ago when I asked them to call me back and they never did then my grandmother received a call from them last night and she told me today when she seen me. So hearing this plus receiving this letter today I did call them only to be told she wouldn’t work with me. I also know that when I worked there and I would help the collector there to make calls you can just click in the computer saying that you called when really you didn’t. I told her I wouldn’t be able to pay her right now Christmas is a few weeks away my sons birthday is also the week of Christmas and my car payment is due this week so I offered to pay November and December’s payment on December 28th the Friday right after the holidays she then told me I would have to pay court cost and do it that way because my account wouldn’t be there any longer.

I have been dealing with farmers for a couple of years now and I always pay my accounts off wayyy earlier than need to be.
This is also the first time I have ever been more than two days late on making a payment. I understand they want their money, but sometimes things don’t work out like that so they should really work with someone who has never been late like that. When I was employed there you still got worked with at 120 days out. It didn’t matter how late you were if they could work with you they would.

name: RACHAEL
text:
I was supposed to have my refrigerator fixed today “ 03/23/2021.. My ice maker and water dispenser does not work... The 1st time the gentleman showed up on time to verify the temperature, model and what needed to be fixed and ordered.  I was okay with that the date was a week ago.  I called Service Care today because at this time I had not received confirmation to verify the time he was coming... There was no confirmation like email, text or no one had called to confirm.  I call the company today and Ms Chen states the parts “may” be in on the 25th of March and I explained to her that this was not explained to me she states the technician does not know when the items comes in I explained to her I don’t know his job of what information should or should not have been relayed to me I just know the date I was told the parts would be in and the date he will be back to fix it.
Of course, I requested to speak to the manager and of course the “MANAGER” is not here but I will relay the message!!!!

Please do not give a date you will fix appliances  if it can’t be done.....

IN THE FUTURE AT LEAST CALL THE CUSTOMER TO LET THEM KNOW THERE IS A DELAY OF DELIVERY OF ITEMS NEEDED SO THE CUSTOMER DOES NOT HAVE TO WAIT!!!!! STILL WAITING, NOT PLEASED AT ALL ... UNSATISFIED CUSTOMER!!!!!

I would not give this one star!!!!!

UPDATE ***03/26/2021**

I’m changing this from “1” STAR TO “4” STARS
The technician and a manager came to my home and apologized for the miscommunication... The part unfortunately would not fix my refrigerator “Ice maker and Water dispenser” because there is a shortage in the wiring and now I need a new refrigerator.  The technician was very professional, detailed in his explanation of why it did not work.  I will use SERVICE CARE again because even thou there was a “ball” dropped in the beginning they did follow up immediately and did not blame everyone else they took OWNERSHIP and that is what we are missing in these days and time....You made a uphappy customer a HAPPY CUSTOMER...

Thank you

resp.text: (Part not available from manufacturer, last one found in the counry, part arrived today, scheduled for today). I apologize, the part required to fix your water dispenser is no longer available from the manufacturer, however we have diligently pursued finding this part through other sources and found the last one available online. I'm sorry about the lack of communication regarding the difficulty of finding this part. We really expected this brand to support their products better with parts availibility. Tracking number 1Z3V582E0318781474 shows that your part was received at 11:42am, and we have confirmed the part is here and good, and our tech will be coming to you in 30 minutes or less!

name: Taliesha Cash
text: I really tried to give this company the benefit of the doubt but after the 4th visit to my house and no resolve  I'm done ..out of $350 and nothing works  my ice maker quit and it was working fine before they started trying to work on my freezer leak ..the freezer is still not closing after the drawer rod and hinges were replaced so that the door would close. it was closing fine and freezing before they touched it...At this point I count it all a lost and I guess I need a new refrigerator sure wish I could have used that $350 on a new one instead of wasting it on all these wasted visits to my house..save your coins and don't call them...

resp.text:
In order to make up for a bad experience, we have offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

This review was written before we refunded this customer. Sometimes a unit is too old, and has too many problems, to justify repair. We issued a refund after the customer decided to buy a new unit rather than approve further repairs. -- Initially we traced her leak to a clogged condensate drain, but she continued to have the leak. After the drain was found clogged again and cleared, it continued to leak. Further investigation found that that her drawer was not closing perfectly because of a defective gear, which was allowing moist room air into the freezer which was building up high levels of frost, which was also causing her drain to clog. When the unit defrosted, it would produce the leak called us about in the first visit. The rails to the drawer were also rusty, which interfered with proper drawer closure. In addition, she had a stuck light switch, which was unrelated to the leak problem.

Obviously won't do business with Service Care or recommend them to anyone for any reason.

In order to make up for a bad experience, we have offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

text: I cannot recommend the Service Care team enough. They thoroughly earned their 5 Stars and exceeded every expectation of top notch customer service one could have. Toxey and his team did everything possible to help me find the part I needed, got it to me in a timely manner, and did so at an extremely fair cost. They put up with my 10k questions and let me pick their brain constantly on symptoms and what it might mean rather than selling me a bunch of parts that may or may not work. If you're looking for a team that will help you with your electronics and do so until the job is done, I would recommend you give them a call first. Thank you for all of your help.

resp.text:
Update: I look forward to hearing from you. Ask for Toxey at 205-956-3777. Thank you!

Wow! I’m so sorry, our hours have been changed for years, and I don’t know why the website wasn’t updated. If you’ll contact me Monday at 956-3777 I would like to hear about your experience and give you a credit towards your service for your wasted gas and time. My name is Toxey McDavid, and I am the owner. - update, I found a part sales page with Saturday hours listed. I’ve contacted our web developer and asked them to hunt these down and fix them. I hope that you’ll contact me and allow me to make this up to you. - Toxey

name: Lee Sharp
text: After waiting a week and a half for the repairman to come fix our LG refrigerator cooling issue, he came, claimed that our compressor needed replacing, and left. A week later, he came back to replace the compressor and fix the icemaker. He did and said it would cool in 24 hours. It did, so we put our food back in the refrigerator. THE NEXT MORNING, it was out again. All of our food was ruined. We had to call the actual LG repairman (which there is only ONE in the city of Birmingham). When he came, he had to AGAIN replace the compressor because the job before was so poor. He also had to replace another evaporator line because it was not working. The icemaker STILL does not work. This is STILL one of the worst experiences. After a month and a half, we finally have a cooling refrigerator, but still no icemaker.

resp.text: Lee, I'm the owner of Service Care and I apologize for your service experience. LG has more than one authorized service company, and I can assure you that we are one of them. I'm just unhappy that you're unhappy, and I would love to hear from you about your experience and do what I can to make it right for you. My company phone number is 205-956-3777, my name is Toxey McDavid, and I truly want to try to make this right.

name: Jacob Melvin
text: Fred has been here several times and always does amazing work. This is the best repair and service company in the business. Great people

resp.text: Thank you, we love Fred (and so does everyone else!). Fred is the nicest person I know, and I'm glad he gave you the kind of experience with your Samsung dryer repair that we love to hear about. If you need us in Alabaster again, we look forward to helping you!

resp.text: This review does not make any sense. -- We were paid by her extended warranty to provide service, and her extended warranty would not just abandon her to have to buy a new unit. We're very confused by this review, as we in no way damaged her refrigerator. We installed two parts, an icemaker and a damper... there's no way we could have damaged her unit, and no way her extended warranty would have told her she had to pay for a new unit (that's not how extended warranties work).

name: Scott Blanchard
text: When our Bosch in-wall microwave went on the blink, I contracted service care to do a fault diagnosis so that I could order the faulty part(s) and repair it. The technician misdiagnosed the problem as a blown fuse. Once I purchased a new fuse and replaced it (an extremely easy process), upon turning on the microwave the fuse immediately blew again. So, I was out my $85 diagnostic fee and still did not know the real issue. My first attempts to get Service Care to complete the diagnosis were unsuccessful, however, after some time, the service care owner called me and we reached a satisfactory agreement. For this reason, I would use Service Care again and can recommend them to others.

resp.text: Thank you Scott for your feedback about this experience, and for allowing us the chance to make it right. We appreciate you, and look forward to helping you in the future.

name: Ron Berry
text: Was professional and on time.  The tech knew exactly what to troubleshoot based on description of the problem.  I will use again.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Ron! We're glad you were satisfied with your service.

name: Your name Your name
text: My LG refrigerator compressor went out. This is one of the companies LG forces you to use. Even with LG covering the expense of the compressor, about 350.00 the quote was 800.00 for then to spend 2-3 hours to repair.  The worst part was the tech told me it was a 50/50 chance it would last. The reason behind the ridiculous price, the tech explained that there was a strong possibility that multiple service calls would be made in the first year and they dont get paid for those, meaning the price hike was to help cover their possible future expense  The going rate from several other companies not affiliated with LG was approximately 400.00 to swap out the compressor, vacume to 5 microns and refill with r134.  Today, I am having another company come to my home and swapping the compressor to the non linear compressor, all paid out of my pocket, the entire job cost me 595.00. So how can it possibly be so much for the LG compressor swap if LG is covering the cost due to warranty? Another noteworthy mentioning is that I told the tech I would mount the compressor myself and would sweat on the copper connections myself, but that wouldn't change the price according to the tech. It's called price gouging and its pathetic. Be very cautious when dealing with this company, there are much better options out there, thankfully I found one, thanks Appliance Service LLC. A small locally owned business with an awesome response time (next day) and an affordable price. He also guarantees his work for a year, same as this one. No, I was not asked to mention his business, but who could resist when these other money bandits are out there preying on the unsuspecting.

resp.text: I appreciate you taking time to talk with me over the phone today about your issues. Your feedback is appreciated and helps us improve the customer experience. I understand where you are coming from, but we are an authorized warranty service provider for LG and we are not allowed to replace any part with a non-standard, experimental part. LG has an extensive process that they require in these repairs, in order to make the replacement compressors they provide function correctly in their units. These requirements add to the ordinary time it takes to repair these refrigerators, that may not be required when using parts that were not made for this unit. Unfortunately, as a warranty provider, our contract prohibits us from using non-standard parts to repair your refrigerator. If you will send us a proof of repair from the other servicer, including the parts used to repair the unit, I would appreciate it. I offered to refund your diagnostic, but did not realize that we did not collect it since we were unable to provide you with the service you desired.

name: Shaunda Kidd
text: Mr. Morgan was on time, and did a great job. Really appreciated his professionalism.

resp.text: Thank you! We're very proud of him, and glad to have him as part of Service Care's family. Happy to service Center Point and take care of your Whirlpool refrigerator.

name: KEVIN FOSHEE
text: Last summer when I had my dryer serviced I thought it was a little expensive, but they did a good job. Well it broke again... But to my disbelief, they honored the 1 year warranty and had the dryer fixed same day at no cost!

resp.text: Thank you! We offer a one year warranty on the services performed to show that we really, really, really stand behind our repairs. And we do! I'm glad we could take care of your Samsung Dryer and hope you don't have any more problems with it.

name: Bucky Wood
text: Very efficient and timely. Expert repair. I will use Service Care and Shay again!

name: Mark Rupright
text:
The power circuit of our five-year old LCD TV blew out and I called Service Care. Barry Beasley came out the next day and verified that it was the power circuit, found a capacitor that had blown, replaced it on the spot, and determined that the damage was more extensive. When he looked up the price of the replacement part, we decided it was more convenient to buy a new TV. He didn't even charge us for the attempt to fix the problem, only the service call!

Barry was very friendly, helpful, and professional. I plan to call on Service Care for other repairs in the future.

name: Catherine Cowden
text: I've known this family for years. My father was a technician with them years ago. Not only was it a wonderful place for him to work and support his family, when it came time for our family to be customers of this company, we were treated like members of their family.

resp.text: The Cowdens will always, always be family. Your dad is a lot of fun, has a good heart, and is one of the coolest guys I've ever known. It's a pleasure providing you with service.

text: I am very pleased with the service ServiceCare provided. They were able to repair my washer in a timely manner and were very professional and courteous. I'm really glad I chose them for my repair needs.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, I'm glad that our service met (and hopefully exceeded) your expectations. It was our pleasure to help you with your washing machine repair!

name: Cindy Cuellar
text: I contacted Service Care in morning and they told me that one of their technicians would be contacting me soon.  The technician, Scott, contacted me 30 minutes later to let me know that he was on his way. Scott and another technician arrived and they were very pleasant and assured me that they would get to the root of the problem with my dryer not heating. Scott checked the fuses, heating element, thermal cutoff, etc. on my dryer and all were working. He determined that the dryer was not heating because the control board on the dryer needed to be replaced. He also recommended that I purchase a new dryer because my dryer was old and it would be much more expensive to replace the control  board and install it. I suspected this might be the end result, but I felt it was best to have the experts make that determination. Despite the fact that I have to purchase another dryer, I was very pleased with the promptness, knowledge and professionalism of Scott and the other technician that came with him, and because of this experience, I will be contacting Service Care in the future if I ever need service on my appliances or television sets. I highly recommend them.

resp.text: We're very proud of the care our technicians show when they come to your home. Scott and Greg are two genuinely good people, that live up to the "Care" in our company name. Proud to have them represent us!

name: teresa spencer
text: Cliff was very friendly and knowledgeable about his job. He’s the best.

resp.text: We're very proud to have Cliff serving all the neighborhoods in 35217, and so glad we could take care of your refrigerator the same day!

name: Patricia Noffsinger
text:
Requested a dryer repair from this service and was very pleased with the overall professionalism and customer service. When the technician came to evaluate my abnormally noisy dryer I was quoted and shown an invoice for parts/labor totaling over $560. I reluctantly chose to have my dryer repaired because buying a new dryer would cost several hundred more dollars. I was also required to pay half of the service fee before Service Care would come out to complete the repair—I assumed so that the very expensive parts could be ordered. When *my technician arrived I was surprised to see him carrying a very small bag of parts and was finished with the repair in less than 30 mins—I was expecting a little bit more for a repair costing well over $500 dollars. Come to find out when I researched the actual cost of parts I found out the parts cost around $35 which means service care charged me nearly 1000k an hr for labor. Please do not use this company. A total scam. Buy the parts yourself, watch a  tutorial YouTube video, and save yourself literally HUNDREDS of dollars.

Heard back from customer service. Per their customer service rep my technician mistakenly charged me for the parts 4 times resulting in a quote that was over $200 dollars more than what it should have been. The invoice I received from the tech clearly states that only one was ordered for a parts/installation fee of $560.11 which alerted my spider sense. Customer service offered me an ultimatum of either $200+ refund because of tech’s alleged mistake (meaning I still paid over $300 dollars to replace a $35 dollar part that took 30 mins to replace) or they would come out to take out the $35 part for a full refund. Despite having been charged a fee of $80+ for an in-home quote which by their own admission was inaccurate they refused to refund that. I only agreed to the repair because based on the description of what needed to be done to repair the unit seemed extensive and beyond my skill set. If I didn’t have to take another day off wrk (on top of the 2 I already had to for the quote and the repair) for them to come out to take back what they put in I would have gladly had them come out and take it out. Found a step by step tutorial video on YouTube and the repair is actually quite simple.

Service Care this type of business practice is shameful to charge such ridiculous amounts of money for simple repairs. This is flat out fraudulent and predatory. Their excuse for such high pricing basically boils down to “We use nationally recognized software to provide quotes...” Translation: We do it because we CAN. Not because it’s RIGHT. They knowingly charge SEVERAL hundred dollars an hr for labor for relatively simple repairs. Buyer beware and be sure to do your research first. This repair could have been easily DIY and done for $35 bucks in parts and a Phillips head screwdriver.

The owner himself discourages buying parts off Amazon in his response but the Service Care website  actually contains a link that customers can use to buy “cheap” OEM replacement parts...from Amazon. :l
Again, a total scam, folks. Stay clear of this place.  Had I not questioned my order I would have been duped.  This is supposed to be a repair that the company does “hundreds” of times but no one from company realized I was over charged by several hundred dollars (not a few dollars but several HUNDRED dollars) until I said something about it. Had I went to Publix to buy a gallon of milk and it rang up for $50, the cashier would have instantly thought, “Huh...it’s usually $3.99. Something must be wrong.” Not Service Care. They will take your money and run without thinking twice about it. They still refuse to refund my in-home quote fee for a quote that was inaccurate.

*Technician’s name removed from review at the request of the owner

resp.text: Hi, I'm sorry you were so unhappy with your experience, and I can see why. The technician made a technical error while building your quote. Instead of quoting for a pack of 4 rollers, he quoted for four 4-packs of rollers. The pricing software that we use thought we were replacing those parts 4 times, which increased the quote. (We would be happy to send you a copy of the original quote, which included the 4 rollers, not one). I feel certain that we would have caught that during our billing process, but we appreciate you calling us so soon after your repair to let us know. We're issuing you a refund for the difference. We stand behind our repairs with a one-year warranty which requires us to use OEM manufacturer parts which are usually more expensive than the cheap ones you find on Amazon. Of course, most of the cost of any repair, from any company, is the labor and skill that it takes to diagnose the problem correctly and replace it in a timely manner. I appreciate the feedback! Good and bad helps us to continuously grow and improve as a company. Listening to our customers has been a huge reason we have been a family and locally owned business for well over 30 years.

name: Anthony Marino
text: Ask questions about ladder work but still charge for service call

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize that you were not completely satisfied with your service. However, we base all of our prices off the Major Appliance Service National Price Guide. By using this guide, we ensure that our customers are getting the best possible repair price for their dollar, considering all the factors that go into providing excellent service.

text: They were not able to fix the problem I was having with my stove due to the parts being discontinued, which was fine by itself. resp.text: *Parts no longer available* -- Thank you for the feedback. I can understand your disappointment that the parts that were no longer available for your repair. I spoke with our technician, and he did not mean to "unfix" your burners. When he demonstrated to your husband that they were working, he tells me he honestly thought that they were functioning properly. I'm glad you are able to use the four remaining burners, and I'm terribly sorry that the parts were not available.

When he looked up the price of the replacement part, we decided it was more convenient to buy a new TV. He didn't even charge us for the attempt to fix the problem, only the service call!

name: Kim Brittle
text: Disappointing experience.  I called for a washer and dishwasher repair.  They could not get a technician out for over a week.  I called another local service who could have someone out the next day.  Once I knew the repair needed (motor replacement), I called them back to ask an approximate price if they indeed diagnosed the same repair when they came.  Russ, who answered the phone, was rude and dismissive.  When I asked my question he said "I don't even work on them so I have no idea on that" rather than trying to refer me to someone who would?  After his response I said well I guess I need to cancel the service call I requested and after asking my number said "yep - you're cancelled".  He did not try to earn my business and made it clear he had plenty of customers and no time for one that dared to ask a question.  Unfortunate, but not someone I would trust with a $400-500 repair, if they are unwilling to answer my question or even try to earn my business.

resp.text: Hi Kim, It's our policy to not provide estimates over the phone, whether it's based on the diagnosis of another company or not. I really feel that our customer service representative could have done a much, much better job communicating with you and helping you to understand why we don't do this, and I apologize for the experience you had.

text: Excellent service!! Will definitely use again and recommend! Scott was very professional and knowledgable!

text:

Tech provided an inflated quote including a part that was not broken.  Also told me it would be at least a week before they could get the parts.

That night, I followed the troubleshooting steps in the manual, and was quickly able to identify the broken part.  He would have also if he'd bothered to use a voltage meter.  Bought the part locally the next day and completed the repair.

Looking back, it was clear he just wanted to collect the service fee and leave.  Would not recommend!

resp.text: ** Cannot find this customer in our system ** --- Although I am terribly sorry you had a bad service experience, I can not find a service call with your first and last name within the past 5 years. --- I've also looked for any calls with your last name in the last 6 months and none of them matched what you described. --- If you received bad service from one of my technicians, I want to know about it and I want to make it right... but I can't find you. Please call 956-3777 and ask for Toxey McDavid (owner) so that I can take care of you. I'm determined to fix this.

name: Tuan Anh Le
text: Mr  toxey reached out to me and we both had a detailed conversation. I am very appreciative that he did that and for that ive become a loyal customer.....very very good customer service....

resp.text: Hi, I'm Toxey McDavid and I'm the owner of Service Care. Please call me at 205-956-3777 so that we can discuss your repair experience. I looked into your repair and checked on the pricing. Our technician charged almost $30 dollars less than the price quoted in our blue-book pricing guide. (This is the guide used by 1000s of appliance repair technicians to price repairs). I also could not find that part for $9 on Amazon. This is a full heater assembly replacement part that includes the heater element, heater housing, and two replacement thermostats and can not be found on Amazon that cheaply. We never use "knock off" discounted parts, only original manufacturer replacement parts. Most of repair costs are actually for labor and diagnosis, and the total time of that process was a good deal more than 15 minutes by our records. I hope to hear from you soon, I want you to be happy with Service Care. Thank you!

name: John Johnson
text:
Wish I could give less than 1 star.  I was told the repairman would be here between 8 and 12, I called at 12:15 to ask about the status of the tech.  I was told that he would not be coming because I never returned a confirmation call.

When I questioned them about the confirmation call I was told they called on three separate occasions.  I had no messages on my machine and no missed calls from their number.  When I told them that fact, they became argumentative about the calls rather than finding a way to resolve the issue.

I would run as fast and as far away from this company as possible.  If you are using this company because you called Lowe's customer service then I would ask the customer rep for another service company.  If you called this company because you found them on the internet then hang up the phone vector they answer.

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

I have apologized to this customer for his bad experience, and offered him $85 towards the next appliance or television repair. Whether we had called him and left messages or not, he had an expectation of service on that day and we didn't deliver. We've taken steps so that will never happen again.

name: Eric Smith
text:
I had a 65" Plasma TV which all HDMI inputs stopped working. I called and I spoke to Russ. I asked for someone to come out to look. After I told them my location I was told it would be $85 to inspect, but if they did repairs it would be subtracted from the labor cost. My TV was expensive so I was willing to accept the risk that it wouldn't be fixed.  and I gave him the model number. The technician called and we arranged a time and he was there in a reasonable amount of time. He asked what the problem was and I explained again that all HDMI ports were not working. He then went to search for a mainboard replacement for the TV. He couldn't find one.

I'm giving them three stars because there was sufficient information given to them to be able to tell me over the phone that they wouldn't be able to find a replacement part. I explained my frustration to the technician. He said that they mostly deal with appliances and he'd never been unable to replace a main board for a somewhat new Panasonic (< 5 years) and that he wouldn't have time to train the staff to get all pertinent information. To me, that's a training issue.

Polite and responsive people, but they need to do better with the information that they are given. They had the part number and the description of the problem. I could have sent them a picture of the back of the TV since that's all the technician needed to see.

resp.text: *We will apply the diagnostic you paid to a future repair* --- I'm sorry that a TV this new is not being supported by the manufacturer. We were as surprised as you were that these basic parts were not available. We will do our best to screen these in the future. I will happily apply the diagnostic fee you paid to a future service call.

text: We have rental property in the Birmingham area. We live on the Gulf Coast and can not check on things unless we ride 4 hours each way. I was able to give all my attention to my wife's needs as once again Service Care handled our appliance problem in Birmingham. My thanks goes out to this company! God Bless!

name: Pamela Gasink
text: We had 2 appliances with issues: a 7 month old GE Profile telescoping downdraft vent (not raising and lowering smoothly) and a Kitchenaid Architect Series dishwasher (leaking water).  The technician, Craig Harris, was professional, personable and most importantly knowledgeable.  After inspecting the downdraft and learning how new it was, he got on the phone with the GE Customer Care Team and they took over the resolution since the product was covered under warranty (in a previous call that I made to GE... they blew me off with the reply that the unit must not have been installed properly... which it was).  That situation was resolved with a swap of the defective GE downdraft.  Craig then diagnosed the DW problem as a broken soap dispenser that was surprisingly allowing the high pressure water to get into a small hole and leak down through the front panel and out to the corners and then onto my floor.  A 2nd visit was required to allow time for the part to be ordered (expensive little plastic booger).  I was very pleased that the very same person was sent for the installation, this rarely seems to happen with most companies. He was very careful not to scratch any outside components or my hardwood kitchen floors.  He was a quick with his work and above all, an expert.

name: thegary clark
text: had an email conformation on a service date, took 1/2 day off to cover the 12-5 service window. No one showed up so I called and was told I had changed the service date. Who the hell does that?

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

Hi, I'm sorry you had this experience. The first service call for the dryer was submitted via our online portal on August 18th at 10pm for a Frigidaire dryer, and scheduled for August 23rd. -- First thing Monday morning, we left a message for the customer to call us to verify the address (and so we could explain what will happen during service visit). -- 10 minutes later, we received a call back and were told that there was another dryer, a Samsung, and would also like that one to be serviced at the same time. A ticket was created at that time, and both were scheduled for the 24th. (Probably because it was now two calls, not just one). -- The initial email confirming the service call would have been sent Friday after the one unit was scheduled online, which is I think the source of the confusion. I'm not sure why the system did not send a followup email with the new information, and I apologize deeply for that. -- We wouldn't claim that the customer called and changed the service date unless we had received a call from someone, and we certainly wouldn't have created a new ticket for this customer unless we had communicated with someone. That just wouldn't make sense for us to do that. -- We're terribly sorry that the experience was confusing, and that you spent time waiting for a call that never came. We take great care to meet and exceed customer expectations, and we will examine our processes in detail to see what could be improved so that this does not happen again.

HOW UNPROFESSIONAL !!!

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

I truly wish I could give a better response to this review, but since I have no customer information to look up this service, I really can't.

If a call was scheduled Friday night for Saturday morning after our technician's paperwork was printed out, it's possible that this could happen. If we had a telephone number wrong, it's possible also that we would not make it out to your home. But I am just guessing without knowing more about you.

I would love to hear from you via our email address ( service@servicecare.net ) with information about this, so that I can make sure this doesn't happen again. This is not  how we treat our customers.

Thank you,

Toxey McDavid
Service Care, Inc.

text: Although my technician tried very hard to eliminate the banging and thumping noise on my new LG washing machine, he was unable to completely fix the problem. He made some adjustments which decreased some of the loud banging and thumping as the machine fills, but now I need to make another call--to whom?  The tech seemed to think the problem was with our house--water pressure pounding the machine.  How do I resolve this?  Thank you for your help.

We did a google search and arrived at Badcock early in the morning and did a loop of Huntsville's furniture stores. After making a decision, we chose to come back to Badcock Home Furniture & More due to a helpful and courteous staff, great prices, a military discount (it is highly appreciated!), and a delivery service that wasn't backed up for weeks.

We can't wait to get our couch and love seat and were happy to do business with this Huntsville branch!

I called several times and put a work order in but the problem is still not fixed. The dinning room table paint is coming off. I recently went into the store to complain about the same issues and was given a $50.00 gift card for the store. Also noticed the dinning room set was recalled so they no longer have that dinning set. It's truly a beautiful set but the quality is awful.

Has anyone else have issues with the grey dinning room set?

name: Carla Davis
text:
I will never do business with Bestway furniture rental again. I had a washer and dryer that I paid over the past year literally about 2,200.00 including interest and weekly payments. They lied to me and told me they would be paid off by now.
I have had to have the dryer replaced twice and the washer replaced because of substandard used products. The poorest quality I've ever seen.
I got behind by a week and I pulled up at my home at 8a.m. and the Bestway truck had been stalking my house and they pulled up quickly blocking me in like some repo man. It was rediculously dramatic.
They took the washer and dryer away as if I was some terrible customer that was several months behind. It was insane. I'm never doing business with these people again and I recommend you stay far away if in need of rental furnishings. Go to Arrons or Rent A Center.

text: They admitted to me that they had overpriced merchandise...

text: Amazing place they are so nice and understanding!

name: Peppa Hall
text:
I wish I could give a negative 1. I ordered a bedroom set with a dresser...The day it came it was missing knobs off the dresser the whole time I was paying on it I called consistently to check to see if the "ordered knobs" came in. All they would say is we have ordered them we're waiting.Needless to say Vincent and the rest of his employees are nothing but Liars it's been a year-and-a-half my furniture is paid off and I still do not have any knobs. I will never ever recommend nobody to go to the store.

And it was my first time using a "rent to own place" .

name: Clarissa Brown
text: Manager was rude. She called when I asked to have a text reminder sent to my phone. I’ve asked them to put me on the text reminder because I work and can’t have my phone ringing off the hook. I’ve already received the text today and an hour later a phone call. The manager jaquella slams down the phone after I asked her about the text messages. And when I called to complain about her being rude she pretended that she didn’t do it. Today is due day not late day I don’t appreciate the rude people that call with the attitudes like the furniture is their furniture and the money belongs to them. You can get more bees with honey than with sour milk.

name: Michael Davies
text: i entered this establishment on 8/25/2020, i was greeted by an employee who was not wearing a face covering. i myself had on my face mask per state and city mandate. i proceeded to the counter to inquire about leasing merchandise. (i have leased with this company on a previous occasion, my experience at that time was very sub par. the delivery was late and the dryer power cord  was damaged to the point of causing property damage to my wall plug in my home.) A red headed woman approached the counter with no mask and asked me "how can i help you?", i replied i am looking to lease a laptop. she then told me "i have the desktop over there" i stated then what kind of laptops do you have " the kind that turn on!" she stated. so i disregarded her unprofessional remark still uneasy about both employees not having on a face covering, and asked to know my options of computer choices. she then with an attitude that i was an inconvenience to her began putting laptop boxes on the counter. i read the specifications and made my choice. she asked if i had leased with them before, i stated yes. it had been more than 30 days since my last lease so i was directed to fill out another lease application. during this time of filling out the application i came to find out the employee that was behaving in this manner was the general manager. she then informed me while i was filling out the rental application that she "hated these mask" and that i did not have to wear mine while in the store. i was now fully uncomfortable from a collection of lack of safety procedure during a pandemic. i continued to wear my mask. once the application was complete another employee then took a copy of my drivers license. the general manager took another 10 minutes to ask me to please come into her office. she was pulling up things on her computer. she then turned to me and rolled her eyes and said" so you have rented from us before huh? " i said yes i have multiple times. she then proceeded to question why i was late on my rental payment. i told this brute of a woman that i had financial hardship and lost my job at the time. i got behind on the lease and once i realized i could no longer afford to get the payments from these loan sharks up to date due to exorbitant late fees and penalties i returned the leased merchandise. she then stated that she "believed in giving second chances". i  acknowledged the comment but did not rebut to the comment. she then looked over more information on her computer. and turned to me and said " being late im ok with, but people keeping merchandise that is not theirs im not ok with!!" at this point i have become very uncomfortable and feel as if my visit to the store this day has become a humiliation session for the store manager. i stopped the woman and told her i felt degraded and would no longer like to do business with this establishment. she then laughed at me and said " fine then". i contacted the corporate office for this company and was informed they condone this behavior. a few notes if you intend to rent from this establishment, you may be exposed to covid 19 by employees or other patrons due to lack of adherence of mask mandate while in this location or lease merchandise that has not been sanitized properly. you will be belittled by the staff if you ever have financial hardship while in a lease agreement with this company as well. i hope this review is helpful to those thinking of leasing from this company. i would recommend the better competitor YOURWAY RENT TO OWN which is located at 2547 Bob Wallace ave. when i left this establishment i went to your way and was able to lease a laptop computer in less than 15 minutes without being belittled or shamed. (quick your way rent to own history) they do not charge daily late fees(best ways policy is built to extort with late fees)  when a payment may be late and will work with you if you hit financial hardship. also the merchandise is of higher quality, the facility is cleaner, with more inviting more professional staff. stay safe out there in this pandemic!

The manager and staff don't care about their customers and will not fix anything. Take your business elsewhere. It's not worth the risk of losing  your hard earned electronics or worst case your home.

name: Tina Thornton
text: I went after I paid my bill at a previous address and took 450. 00 deposits as the 800 # told me too to put power on in my name at my trailer here in Jacksonville. They have on file that I'm on oxygen 24 hours a day. I owe a large bill from a different address years ago and had made 50.00 money payments on it. But still owe. The 800 # said it wouldn't be a problem that I just take my money and confirmation and they would work with me again on the big bill. So I get there when the door opens at 8:15 a.m. go to the older lady teller she leaves her desk goes in the back for 15 minutes I waited she comes out with her hand on her hip standing behind a tall skinny man with brown hair a supervised. He never said his name. He was very rude and demeaning said no I will not work with you on this bill, I DONOT care that you are on oxygen, and I DONOT care if you are on disability either. Before this power is put in your name you have to pay 2,223.57 ! Plus a 450.00 deposit. I was in tears the power was on at that point. I begged I even tried to just set up my card that my disability comes on for autopsy for my old bill and new ones. But he was very very rude loud and mean. I cried walking out the door. Very bad. Customer service, not friendly at all. Not understanding of people's disabilities or life situations. An hour after I was home on January the fifth this happened, they came and cut off my power. Knowing everything! In January! Winter. Alabama power is hurtful and hateful! The bill was originally 1490.00 they added all kinds of service fees LTE fees plus turned it over to collec5ions for more fees Wich put it up over 2200.00! Not to mention in 2013 I filed chapter seven bankruptcy and this was supposed to have been put in my depts owed as well.😥😥😥 I am very hurt and now have no idea when I'm going be able to get my power on. Prepaid power is in part of Jacksonville, but Alabama power has a monopoly hold in the area that I live!

text: At first glance customer service was great, the older gentleman that delivered was awesome! However, the general manager does not care about her customers needs and has caused a great inconvenience for me. After being treated terrible on the phone while wanting to return my fireplace I told her instead at this point I wanted to return all of my items because of the way she spoke to me. Then she scheduled a pickup for the following Tuesday at 4pm, I waited until 10pm for delivery drivers to show up calling them multiple times to be told yes they will be there. After 7pm no further answer on the phone, and I was left awake waiting on Aaron's to show up to retrieve their items and now my wife and kids have to navigate a maze of furniture in my house until they show up.

resp.text:
Hi Jamie, Thanks for letting us know and we are sorry you feel this way. Could you email me the details of your experience the store you were dealing with and a good number to reach you to myexperience@aarons.com?

name: Deirdre Taylor
text: I only go to home Depot if Lowe's doesn't have what I need, and that's rare. I always have a problem picking up orders. You can't just call in to have it brought to you by curbside because they claim to be too busy to get your information. When you go in, if the order is not in that little closet behind them, they'll just tell you it's not there rather than to go to the back and get it. I order a lot and never have a problem with Lowe's. It took an act of congress to finally get my complete order from Home Depot. One young lady, Kia went out of her way to help me and it wasn't even her department. Thanks to her I have everything. I only shop here when I absolutely have no choice.

name: Silvery Nova
text: The first problem is the delivery service company that Home Depot uses for direct deliveries,Central Transport. My 1st initial delivery date changed three time before it was actually attempted to be delivered on March 3rd. On March 3rd the shipment came on a long bed truck with a pallet dolly. My shipment is a pallet of 33 boxes of porcelain tile., plus 7 additional boxes they put on the same pallet. The right side of the pallet was coming apart due to the immense weight of the tile . The driver could not move the pallet down the truck. He was not going to be able to pull it up the small slope on my driveway. What on earth were they even thinking?They needed a fork lift. I called Home Depot and they got the Transport company on the line while I was on hold. I ended up being told the transport company needed to take care of this and they would contact me in 24 to 48 hours. Which they never did. I had to call them. On 3/5 Friday I called central transport and they told me the shipment would be delivered on Monday between 11 and 12. They never showed. I checked the shipment tracking and found that they changed it to Tuesday 3/9! I got no call, text, or phone call.So Tuesday 3/9 I message them to find out eta. They said the drivers hadn't left yet and to keep checking they will update me. That never happened. So I wait and wait and I get a call from Home Depot letting me know the tile has arrived at THE STORE. I was never told anything about this.They will be delivering the tile on Monday 3/15....
