text: Online order pickup inside store was super easy. Total transaction was about 3 min. I even had someone ask me if I needed something. Unfortunately that night I was only browsing  but Thanks to the lady working in the appliances department for actually engaging.

text: Love home depot.. They had alot of stuff at decent prices and the employees were really friendly and helpful. They now have self checkout so checkout was a breeze too. It wasnt crowded and displays made things very easy to find on my own.

name: Sandra Cauley
text:
I went in the garden center and told girl at registry, that  I wanted 2 medium bags of Miracle-Gro potting soil, and help getting it n putting it in car.  No help came, then she told me go in back pick it up.  Finally realized she charged me for garden soil, I ask her to give me potting soil and charge me for the difference.  She said she couldn't, I had go customer service.  I told her I wasn't able, that why I parked out in front garden center and ask for help.  I told her I would eat the loss and never come there again.

I don't like be hard get long with, but it was her mistake, why should I have go customer service, when I have trouble walking that distance.  I will use Lowes from now on.

I'm a 100% Service Connected Disable Veteran.

text: Came just to check out the garden center/plants selection. Very minimal, but prices are decent. If looking for a larger selection of flowering, herbs, or trees go to Lowe's. Home Depot's tropical plant section is good however.

text: Great service as always! Purchased a small metal gate for my flower bed to keep the dog out but didn't realize the poles that stake into the ground were missing. They found them straight away when I went back and made it stree free

name: Zash
text: Needed some rope but it was locked up behind glass. Could not find an employee to help. Asked the Paint Dept person to call us some assistance. Waited 10 more minutes but no one came. Hunted down someone again but they didnt know the combination to the lock that was gaurding the rope. Was in the store 30mins just for 10ft of rope!

name: melissa renee
text: The lady who sold us a washer and dryer was very nice no problems at all. I have a problem with the fact that they were supposed to be delivered at my house on April 21st. It got delayed so they moved the delivery date to Today ( April 24th ) but I never got any notification so I called and they told me that they don’t deliver to my area on saturdays, only Wednesdays and they don’t deliver when the weather is rainy. It’s been SUNNY all day. No bad weather AT ALL. Now the delivery date has been moved to May 12th. I will be giving birth in May so that’s really annoying 🙄 I ordered my washer and dryer on MARCH 3RD!!!  I hope the warehouse manager makes this right.

name: Jessie
text: Went to buy an appliance that I saw online. Called the this particular store literally on my way over there. Young lady told me that indeed they had the sale item which I was inquiring about. I get to the store and spoke with someone worker in appliances I ask him again to verify of what I wanted. He walks back and confirms my injury. Rung me up just to realize he mentioned through conversation of the appliance he thought I was asking of. Which I corrected him and pointed out and literally touched again the same appliances that I wanted. Apparently some way some how after all this confusion. They magically had sold out. So my thinking leads me to believe the person I spoke to on the phone didn't bother to check or maybe something with system either way wasted my time and here's the kicker the way the guy tried to put it was like I could go to another home depot after I already paid. Luckily my bank released this debit transaction. Poor poor salesmanship and somewhere along the line communication is lacking. I hope I can revisit this location in the future without this issue.

I actually feel bad because I lost the receipt and cannot remember her name so I could go back and submit a survey to help her employer see her worth.  If I get back there and she is there, I will make it a point to find out her name and then submit a survey for her.

text: For the most part they have what you need just keep in mind do not rely on finding help ..to find what you need you literally have to look through several aisles to find anyone that works there. I also had to deal with one employee who had a very smart aleck attitude I almost told her just walk away it was that bad. Sometimes the clearance item priced stuff is phenomenal sometimes it's not a deal at all. The return warranty is a huge problem they want to make you pay a checkout fee for a broken item even if it comes back as broken and needs to be replaced they still want you to pay $35 diagnostics fee this is totally wrong on every level. I actually purchased a pressure washer could not get it to work they sent it off come back and said there was nothing wrong with it I said let's go to the garden center let's hook it up to hose and let's find out ..so finally they agreed after I insisted guess what it didn't work they still wanted $35. The extended warranty is 100% a joke it's just a way to steal money.

name: Robyn Curry
text:
**EDIT**
Since the freezer mishap below the management staff (namely Dave) has gone above and beyond to make things right by me. I feel like The Home Depot has redeemed themselves and they have earned my business once again.

I ordered an upright freezer to be delivered to my home. I missed three days of work for no-show deliveries and countless hours on the phone trying to get a freezer delivered and all I got in return was excuses and finger pointing. I had three managers from the West Mobile location involved in this situation (Dave, Cameron, and Jonathan) as well as the customer service help line. They were all aware of the fiasco that had occurred with this delivery yet when I asked what could be done no solution was offered. After a month of no freezer from the Home Depot I cancelled the order and bought one from Lowe’s. I had it the very next day. The Home Depot was always my go-to home improvement store but in light of the lack of customer service in this particular situation I think I’ll reconsider that.

name: Shaun Steffensen
text:
If you order appliances from somewhere, do yourself a favor and not order from Home Depot. First, the people who are selling the appliances do not know much about them. I was told that for installation of my microwave, I needed an outlet in the wall that it was being installed on. Great. I'm good. WRONG!!! The outlet had to be above the microwave.... Something that would have been nice to know, but they could not communicate that properly.
Then, the delivery/installation people had no idea what they were doing. They were more of a delivery company, not an installation professional. They could not install my gas range. They damaged my microwave. So, really, they weren't even a good delivery company. Home Depot just subs out delivery to the cheapest company....and you can see the quality when your damaged items arrive!
And I pray for you if you have ANY problems with your delivery or installation!!!
Count on a couple of things: 1) You will spend hours on the phone getting to talk to the right person. Once you think that you have the right person, they will tell you they have to check on something and they will have to call you back. OR, the right person is "on lunch" and they will call you back. After giving them ample time for "lunch" (3 hours) when you call them back, you will be told that they were "off today" but they will return your call in the morning.
Basically, it's a game of ping-pong and it takes days to get simple questions answered because, obviously, no one who works there wants to actually do anything.
I can't believe I dropped over $7K in there and they can't even answer a simple question!!!!
Buyer beware!!! Shop at Lowe's!!!

name: Lacey Paquin
text: I ordered $1,600 worth of appliances on black Friday to furnish my investment property. I scheduled them to be delivered on Friday, 12/22, and I was told the delivery time frame would be from 2pm-6pm. I planned accordingly and the my appliances were never delivered! No CALL or anything. It took me 4 different phone calls to reach an actual person. The delivery people could not be reached. I waited at the property until 10pm. I went to the store the next day and spoke with the manager, and apparently I was the 3rd customer complaining of no delivery and no notification. The store could not reach the delivery service because they were closed, and would not re-open again until that Tuesday after Christmas. I was told they "might" start calling customers then to attempt to re-schedule deliveries. I found this to be completely unprofessional and unacceptable. I cancelled my order and was refunded my money. I am showing my rental Wednesday and it will be empty. Home Depot has hurt my business.

text: Unfortunately I had been shopping with lowes. It had been on more than occasions than not a terrible experience. I decided to try Home Depot in my recent purchase of a bathtub. Within the first 5 minutes of being inside the store I was greeted by 4 associates. All of which were very welcoming and friendly none of which I have ever experienced at lowes. They pointed me in the direction I needed to go. Upon my arrival of the bath tub isles another associate was there eager and ready to assist me. He opened the merchandise and checked for defects and everything to my satisfaction. None of which I have ever experienced at lowes. Even on the way to check out associates asked if there was anything more they could do to help. Overall my experience at Home Depot was outstanding. I work in customer service and a lot of places lack in that department. Job well done!

text: OK . Selection really good. Staff . . .really - I mean Really nice . . Even the two young men that delivered my purchase. I'm thinking a recliner next. Oh and the best part. The prices are wright.

name: Emily Hanson
text: If I could give this place a zero I would! I have never even done reviews because it really depends on the day and person every where but this place is HORRIBLE!! First me and my husband bought an entertainment center and had to send it back 3 times for being damaged. The last time there was damage but you couldn’t see it that bad so we just kept it. We should have learned our lesson then!! The next time we bought our daughter a new bedroom suit and we bought a new kitchen table. We knew it was on back order for the bedroom suit but the table would be in sooner. We were called when the table came in set up the delivery time. On the day of Delivery for the table our time was 2-5, at 5 when we had not heard anything I called the store. They gave me a number to call the delivery guys because they said they couldn’t get ahold of their delivery guys. I’m not sure how a customer was supposed to get ahold of the delivery guys before the actually store but I called anyways. Of course no answer. Called the store again and the manager just kept telling me he didn’t know and to have my husband call him. Why do you need to speak with my husband when I’m the one calling?? My husband called and we were finally told they found the truck but we need to reschedule the drop off! Nope we will not we need it today! Me and my husband went to the store and picked it up. We chalked it up to understaffed due to covid and left it at that although still upset the manager will not talk to me only my husband. Now for TODAY! Manger called my husband (although he has my number) told him all the furniture would be in on Tuesday. Rather then wait around on another pointless delivery fail we said we would go in today on Thursday to pick up the furniture. My husband goes in and…. The manager said the furniture is not there and they can’t find it….. WHAT?!?!? Are you kidding me?!?!? My husband calls me at work at this point I’m done I’m furious I call up there to see what’s going on and the manager says YOUR TO UPSET I CANT TALK TO YOU! I WILL ONLY SPEAK WITH YOUR HUSBAND!!!  I have to call my husband (because I’m at work and can’t go up there and deal with it in person like I would like to) he has to call the store. Blah blah they offered him the furniture on the floor but the dresser is cracked! Are you kidding me no I’m not taking a cracked dresser after all this nor would I take it before all of this.He tells my husband he can come get the bed and nightstand we will have to wait on the dresser of course . We said since that is our only option it will have to do but we will NEVER AND I MEAN NEVER buy from this store and I’m going to corporate about all that has happened and how the manager here has a problem with speaking to woman!!

name: Carrie Lackey

text: We bought our washer/dryer a couple of years ago from them and have loved it. We called Sears Hometown Repair in Foley and they quickly sent out Daniel who opened the washing machine and said it was a simple fix with the hose!! I told him about the other repair company and he was gracious enough to track down the part we needed and come out the following day and fix it!!! He only charged us $100 for the part AND labor for both days!!! Can’t brag on him enough as well as this store. They are honest, efficient and very professional. Thank y’all again!

name: Kristin Willis
text: I ordered a washer online and picked it up on a Thursday. Once we got it home and took it out of the box we noticed that the front of it was caved in. We called Sears and they told us to bring it back up there. They wouldn't do any kind of scratch and dent discount or I would have took it right back home. Instead they ordered another one and said it would be there the following Tuesday & that they would deliver it for free. Come Tuesday still no washer in and they said they would call me back to let me know when it was supposed to be in and I never received a call. That next Monday I finally received a call that my washer was in but couldn't be delivered until the following day. I ended up going and picking it up bc I was tired of having to wash my clothes in the sink. I will never get anything from there again!!!

resp.text: Kristin, I am the District manager for this area, Please provide your contact info so we can discuss the incident in detail. We strive to provide the best customer service as we are locally owned and operated. We want to make sure that we learn from every experience and meet your expectations.

name: Joanna Knight
text: I visited the store in Troy, AL   I specifically told the sales clerk that I wanted to purchase a living room suit on the no interest plan.  This was on a Saturday and she gathered my information.  She sent it in and told me initially that I was denied.  After review, she indicated that the denial was on an old address.  Once she entered my correct address she told me I was approved.  She asked me did I want to make a down payment but did not indicate that the interest free was subject to a down payment.  So, I declined to make a down payment.  Upon receiving my first statement it indicated I was charged interest.  When I talked to the same lady she indicated that approved the account that charged interest.  No, I did not.  She neglected to give me the full details.

resp.text:
Customer service is incredibly important to us, and we regret we didn't provide you with the
experience you expected, Joanna. If there is anything we can do differently that might better serve you as

name: Phyllis. M. Maguire - Brewer (Babydoll)
text: Four months ago after a fiasco with our washer and dryer breaking down we decided to go to Aaron's and see what kind of deal they could offer. We chose a washer and dryer set that was returned back to the store. Aaron's gave us a good price and we would own the set within twelve months. The second month we had the set our washer broke down and I called the manager of the store and she promptly made arrangements for a loaner washer. As it turned out we liked the model and color of the loaner washer so I inquired about getting a dryer to match and we have been so happy with the service and price.

resp.text:
Hi Phyllis,

Thank you for sharing details about your experience with your local Aaron's store. We appreciate you taking your time and providing your feedback. Have a great day!!! --Tavius

name: Alfy White
text: Im on my husbands account. A guy from Aarons came to my parents house today. I was alone by myself.im 21. I told the man my parents werent there they went to town that theyd be back soon. He said he needed the fridge and demanded i let him in the house. I told him that its not my house to let him into that my parents will be back soon. He said he used to work in law enforcement and if i didnt let him in hed call the police. He was acting aggressively mad. I was home alone and this man acted like he wanted to come at me. At this point im scared. I tell him that im going inside to. Call my parents. He insists to talk to them on the phone. Which i did not let him do. He was making me very uncomfortable. I come back outside and tell him that they're on their way to pay the bill. He drives really fast out of my yard almost hitting my mail box. Never in my life have i seen or experience anything like this.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear this, and thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will look further look into this issue for you. If you have any additional information, please email us at myexperience@aarons.com. Thanks -- Phil

name: Valerie Edelmann
text:
Needed to purchase a lift chair that can also be laid back far enough to sleep in it for my husband. Due to my own health issues,  I  needed to call prior to going into the store to get as much information as possible about the choices. A wonderful young lady named "Turtle" helped me on the phone.But she wouldn't be there when I could be there. She told me her sister would be there and Mechel would make sure Turtle got credit for the sale. (I had wanted Turtle to get the credit since she took so much time helping me.) When we got there to the store, Mechel was so sweet and ready to help. We ended up purchasing 2 matching chairs to be delivered on Friday! (He has impending hip surgery and I need knee surgery.)

In a time when customer service has decreased and prices have increased, the quality customer service at our Badcock's is greatly appreciated!

resp.text: It was a pleasure to have you shop with us, Valerie! Thank you for taking the time to rate our store and share your feedback.

text: Home owned and operated Appliance store. The staff is knowledgeable about the products and services. They do their own deliveries. They have their own repair service and parts department. You don't see any of this with the national chain stores.

name: Emily Miles
text: We are currently remolding a house and choose to use Bob Wallace for all our appliances. Seeing the house is located in Rogersville Florence was the best location for us. It is a smaller store. However, after calling we spoke with a salesman by the name of Anthony. He was very helpful, I let him know we were looking for Kitchen aid appliances and wanted to see/touch them before purchasing. I gave him the item numbers and he let me know he had a few of them on the floor in a different color.  So headed out and met with him and looked over everything in stock, decided on our purchase which totaled up to around 15K, but then Anthony worked his magic and we left writing a check for 10k! So not only was Anthony helpful he saved us quite a bit of money!  I highly recommend Bob Wallace!

name: P Harlow Rhoades
text: I called the store and talked to Wayne.  He told me he had a Speed Queen. Paid for it over the phone. In 2 hours time 2 STRONG young men came to install it and tested it and showed me how it works!  Dakota was great as was his partner with the curly hair.  Both great, careful installers.Thanks for making my day!

Said they had dealt with that in the past. We would never in a million years do such a thing. Felt accused that he would even suggest such a thing over the phone to me. He said he would repair them before he even looked at them or knew what had caused them to stop working. Then on second call said it would be two days before anyone could even look at them. Will never use Hunt's Appliances in Florence after those phone call experiences.

text: I love to go here for all my home improvement needs, I would have given 5 stars but for the lack of associates being available for assistance and the extreme price for wood.I had to note that. Covid has made some places lose workers, maybe it will pick back up soon and the price hike on wood is ridiculous but it is everywhere you go. Customers shouldn't have to pay for all the lost business, we suffered too. Lattice $70 Lowes has always been pricier than Home Depot anyway, I guess you pay for that extra service.

name: Brannon Herzing
text: Good job. It's not like these are cheap. Why would you put this box under the other boxes I have?

name: J Martin
text: I'm not exactly sure what the deal is with this place. The lady in hardware is especially nice and knowledgeable. It's just hard to find anyone. No one seems to know where anything is, the lumber saw was broken, and just seems generally under staffed. Once I went in needing help finding a specific fitting for a pipe. There was a group of men standing there talking, and I couldn't really get any of them to help. I went to the customer service desk and waited for a page for about 10 mins. I just left. That was the first time that happened. Usually if you can find someone, they're extremely nice and helpful, but you have to hunt for them. Another time a fellow customer ended up explaining the tools I needed and where to find them because there was no one to be found. I don't really leave bad reviews, but this store needs more employees it seems like. And some serious help.

name: Michael Perry
text:
Like Home Depot - it is very extremely hard to get good assistance from store associates.  They are few and far between.  If or when you do finally get some assistance - they are extremely untrained for an area that they are not assigned to.

All associates should be highly trained in all areas of the store.  And there should be more associates to assist customers.

name: Jimmy Melvin
text: The customer service is usually on point. The only reason for the 3 stars is this location is consistently out of basic materials needed for electrical work. There have been several times I’ve had to actually look on the top shelf at overstock to find what I need if it’s even there. The store however is kept clean and aisles clear.

name: Samantha Wiley
text: Why does your website guarantee satisfaction within thirty days of a paint purchase and claim I can exchange it or get money back? I was just told by the paint desk and customer service your company does not do that. They said people come in showing the website all the time but never do it.

name: jenn0810
text: Nobody cares about customer service any more. Can’t even get someone to check out a 75 year old veteran when there are several people with their aprons on standing around talking to one another. No reason to tell someone to check themselves out and you getting paid to stand there. Absolutely ridiculous.

name: Fitzgerald Hampton
text: Had a bathroom project I was doing I needed a small havksaw and extra blades.  I found everything with no problem made the purchase and left the store. Had no customer associate interaction whatsoever. Which goes back to me saying that Lowe's has very limited amount of associates working throughout the day in each department and they don't have anyone to help customers when needed.

name: Valrie Niblett
text: Lots of parking easy entry and exit handicapped accessibility clean clean restrooms helpful employees I went to look at plants they had a large variety I was pleased at the prices of what I bought.I went inside and found a plant to put in a seashell I had brought home from the beach that was a surprise.I noticed they had everything to turn your outdoors into your own oasis.Grills canopies plants furniture firepits torches and so much more.Happy hunting always check your local stores website for great deals

name: Billy Hughes
text: While exceptionally stocked, what I needed was not in stock. Still love building supply stores.

text: I walked in this store to buy only 1 item. There was a store employee right at the front door stocking shelves and I asked for help. He stopped what he was doing and located my item . Now my item was on a shelf 25 feet up . He located a lift to get my 1 item . My shopping was finished in 5 minutes. Store was clean and employees very helpful. I will return.

Go to store, Multiple times because I can't get anyone on phone to help, only to see employees doing nothing, probably why no assistance on the phone. Same manager(Donovan) walking around not managing and still no install. Thanks for the horrible experience of shopping. Smh...we have to get someone who knows what value is...them folks in there...nvm

Usually pretty understanding of these things but this is by far some of the worst service I have ever experienced. After a late order and being told they would deliver on another day of my choice it still comes on a different day and multiple items broken. I cannot suggest using this location for any delivery purposes.

Plus Garage Door Opener and all Yard Tools...they gave me a Tremendous Buy for it ALL!! THANKS LOWES HOME IMPROVEMENTS...I WILL BE BACK!! 😊

text: They seem to be genuinely nice people. But it always seems as if there is more demand than they have people to cover.

name: Tremaine Sudduth
text: I’ve never had this problem before but my family and I were in the garden section at Lowe’s in Fultondale. We were the only 3 in that section and we heard over the intercom customer service needed in the garden section. We haven’t pressed any button to call for help or anything. Next thing we see like 3 Lowe’s employees walking around watching us like we were trying to steal freaking plants! They literally followed us until we went to self checkout. Then more started gathering around watching while we were checking out. I feel like they were racial profiling by sending that many employees to follow us and I felt very uncomfortable

name: Kevron Jimerson
text: Great selection, but related items are not located together. Example: Faucets are in one area while washer assortment kit is located near the front of the store.

name: Tracie Brasher
text: Price clearly stated above product but product range up wrong  manager said price has to be on actual product for him to give it for that price. Nothing in the store has price on actual product hardly. Spent over an hour and still unresolved.

name: C Tuck
text:
If I could give zero stars I would!

So, in 2017, We had Lowe’s install new gutters with gutter guards (at their suggestion). We noticed that our roof above our front door has started to leak even more now, so we called our insurance about it. They checked it out, confirmed there was damage. Referred someone who could get the job done. Simple, claim stuff. The guy who is replacing our roof observed that the gutters were actually installed wrong and are causing water to sit on my roof AND rotting the wood underneath the shingles. LOWES will not do anything about it because of when they were installed and because they went through a contractor. SMH. Wish I’d known that before I bought all my bathroom remodeling supplies from them, I will no longer buy from Lowe’s. They have installed carpet in my house, through contractors before, I never thought I would have to go behind them and check accuracy and quality! I have my living room and kitchen that I am gettin ready to remodel, sadly I’ll have to shop elsewhere! I am a very DISAPPOINTED customer!

name: Catherine Owens
text: Best customer service I have received in a long time.

name: Ray Blackwell
text:
Didn't have what I was looking for.
Got something else instead.
Place was busy as all get out.
But plenty of people working in the store. They made a suggestion for a different item. Make a purchase on it.
Hope it's close to the same thing.

name: Jim Anderson
text:
Called before I drove 40 minutes to see if they had what I was looking for, Waited on hold for over 30 minutes trying to get someone to pick up the phone in the appliance department, never did pickup.
The Operator that I dealt with was very rude  and proceeded to tell me it was not her job to do anything but answer the phone.
Finally drove 40 minutes to the store and they did not have what I needed,it would have been very nice to have known that before I went.
I mean seriously I will try and never do business with these people again.

text: I am continuously calling about a questions about a problem with my appliance delivery.  This is my 10th call today and NOBODY ANSWERS the phone in any department.  When someone did answer, I was placed on hold and then the phone dropped.  In fact, I have just been transferred by the 2nd person who answered and still, nobody will pick up the phone and my call was just dropped once again. What is going on here?   Very unprofessional.  Back to Home Depot.  Will try not to use Lowes and certainly not Fultondale ever again.

I recommend you stay away from this location if you desire any sort of customer service assistance.  It is dismal to say the least. You may want to work on that Lowes!!

name: Joyce Wohn
text: The 4 star is for the store not her. As a first time getting paint at that store,and a new customer, the lady behind the paint counter was Rude, not knowing what to do lines and the such, I waited and finally she said,  if you want paint go to that window she pointed, we told her  we in area didn't seem to change her attitude. Gave color needed and.finised shopping. Picked up paint , not realizing she left set paint on side of can. What a mess, didn't notice the paint, she should have. I never got paint from a store like that. It shows she doesn't care.

text: The workers were honest, helpful. I will be back, for more shopping

name: Judi Castro
text:
Went to find some fall perennials and for the most part found what I was looking for.  It was labor day and I was surprised it wasn't really busy.  I had a list of plants I was interested in getting. Found all but one. Unfortunately help was as elusive as the plant was. Shree was our checkout person and she was very sweet and was only one working.  We purchased an item that she placed in a bag and I forgot to ask for it and Shree forgot to get it off the round.
Still a lovely day to go plant shopping.

name: Robert Metcalfe
text: Good prices. Service a little slow but they were busy.

We went to Lowes in Fultondale Al.  We went looking for freezers to look at before we buy.  No large freezers on display (above a 7 cu ft).

In appliances,  Ailes were blocked, couldn't get to appliances easily.  Employees work and personal attire was laying on displays and merchandise (saw employee get into his backpack and shirt for phone).  I haven't seen this Lowes look so bad.

text: I was using a certain paver for several, incomplete, projects. Lowes stopped carrying them last fall. So, now I need to find another to replace them. The competition has a similar item, but is different in size. There will be a visible break, but can't be avoided. Sorry Lowes, thought I could depend on you.

Lowe’s needs to learn a few things from them. I still never got hold of anyone. I’m trying to find status of appliance order done a few mths ago. Sad the store has gone down hill lately.

To the guy who decline to help.. Thank you for allowing me to receive service from someone helpful. :) I hope you learn that customer service comes before stocking.

text:
Can’t ever get anyone to answer the phone. Lowe’s website tells you to call to confirm if an item is in stock, what a joke! They operate without care because they are the only game in town. We need a Home Depot in north Birmingham. This is not a reflection of the employees. It is a reflection of the store manager. He exceeds store financial objectives purely because locals have no other choice. Competition would be a game changer!

I will continue to drive to Trussville Home Depot where customer service is first class.

When something is out of stock or it hadn't been restocked yet surely the employee working in the areas should know their areas well enough to know how to find it's temporary location or if it has been reordered within a reasonable amount of time without having to find several others just to ask how to find it. I could of done it myself on their website on my phone. So what is their presence for?  I'm all for jobs but paying someone to just work there only drives the cost up to customers.

It’s been a week and they still  don’t have the information.

text: A worker there had a attitude did not like her, I got some paint, was very rude,  left paint on the can, didn't wipe the can off it got on the cashier hand, she best be glad it didnt get on me, if she didnt want to be there she should have stayed at home, 🤨

name: Constance Watkins
text:
I paid for an upright freezer on 7/15/20. While in the store the clerk stated that they had 1 more left and that it could be delivered the next day.  I  waited from 8am to 8pm for the appliance.  When I finally got someone,  the appliance was not on the truck or in the store.
I was then told that it was ordered.   2 weeks  later another delivery day was set up.   By the end of the day, no freezer.      A month later received  a call and text message for next day delivery.   Again, no delivery.  By the forth call and text which was on a Sunday,  I  called the store and .o one would answer the phone.   Later that evening when I did get someone, still no product.    I called  the corporate office and complained.   I never got a call to apologize for my inconvenience. I spoke with the corporate office about getting my money back and was told the store could do it over the phone.   When I called and finally got someone to answer the phone. I  was told that I had to come in. When I got there, the clerk said they could not give me the money for the warranty.   At that point I  demanded  my money and the manager
The clerk walked off and someone else came and told me the manager was in a training meeting.  Considering All That I'd been through,  the manager should have come out.  He was the only one that could authorize the refund.   It took 2. Weeks to get my money credited back to my card.  I will never go to Lowes in GARDENDALE ever again
The service was horrible and management a joke.  If you are handicap this is not the store to go to.  90 days of lies and he'll is what I got.  Considering that the merchandise was paid for and my account FLAGGED TO give a phone call on updates, I received NOTHING.
VERY POOOOOR SERVICE.

name: Meredith Burgett
text: Went in to purchase wood for a bedroom and the sales associate was super helpful and made it a flawless process.

name: Leann Talley
text: If I could give no stars I would. Supposed to have a Refrigerator delivered on 4-22-2020, they called said the truck was down ok that’s fine was told I would get it the next day. I had to go to the store to find out what was going on because the can’t bother to answer phones was told I couldn’t get it till Sunday. Told them to give me my money back it was processed then they tell me it will take 7 days for my money to be back. NEVER AGAIN WILL I BUY ANYTHING FROM THERE

name: Pat Lively
text: One check out person at 1:15 on a Saturday with about 14 people in line. Self  check out wasn't any better. Several people just got out of line and left.

text: Please never go to this Lowe’s. We’ve ordered carpet and storm door from them and both times they messed up our order. They also would not fix their mistake. Worst customer service ever.

text: I shop at Lowes often, the draw back I have is they don't stock enough products in backstock and I have to go to Homedepot.

name: Larry Brown
text: Great Selection!

name: Kayla Nash
text: I ordered a curbside pickup. Yes it says to wait till an email is sent to pick it up but I was already  nearby, so I decided to wait. In the hour and a half I sat here.... 1 person was brought their pickup. If I saw more activity, I would understand but 1 in an hour and a half!!!

name: Ziggy Z
text: Great variety, great customer service, neat and clean.. They have a lovely assortment of plants and flowers

name: Stephen Brown
text:
I like this lowes. They have a great selection and they're conveniently located. Only problem is they almost ALWAYS have everything Kobalt up in top stock. And with the exception of 1 or 2 people, no one seems interested in looking for it. They just say "we don't have it". So I routinely go and find it myself, and ensure I go back to the same employee that didn't want to work, and tell them I found it for them. The look on their face is always amusing.

Other than never having their HOUSE brand actually on the shelf, I enjoy shopping here.

name: Jesus Tejeda
text: I was going to buy 2x10x12 pressure treated wood and needed to have it cut in half but they said since it was treated wood they couldn’t cut it cuz it messed up they saw and they didn’t have a special blade to cut treated wood lol, really i guess they need to call home depot to see if they sell blades for pressure treated wood...

text: Found the flowers that I was looking for to plant. Very nice customer service!

name: Joe Glazier
text:
Have to say I wS pretty disappointed on this trip.  This store has gone way downhill in the past few months.  I went to the lumber department to price wood for a project. A full third of the bins were empty.  The sad thing is that what they did hqve out was in the wrong place!  2x6x10 where the 4x6x12 should have been.  All of it was like this.  It was impossible to tell what the price was on anything!

Throughout the store, asiles were blocked by pallet jacks or buggies, making navigation difficult at best.  To think I drove nearly an hour just to go here....

name: Joshua Dendy
text: A handful of good people overshadow the plethora of awful ones.

text: Slowest company!!!!!! Curbside here is a joke. Took 40 mins.... 🙈🙈🙈

text: Joined the Pros Services and very first order was damaged by delivery driver as well as damage to my property.  Buyer beware because Lowe's corporate has not been easy or pleasant to deal with on the damage claim.  Closing my Pros account and will be shopping at Home Depot.

name: Lazlow Wandschneider
text: I like Lowe's a lot. If you are going to shop there often get a Lowe's card and you get 5% off every time you buy anything. 10% off on special weekends. Pay it off every month and it's like free money.

text: They have all kinds of stuff. Unfortunately this day it was one of those days to stand in line they didn't have much help. I'm sure we'll be back though.

name: ANTHONY HAMILTON
text: Awesome customer service

name: Dr. D
text: I purchased a stove and everything that could go wrong did and with terrible customer support. First they never called me to confirm my delivery date of my product. I found it online which was a Monday. Well they showed up Sunday unannounced. Lucky i was there but unfortunately there was a dent. I called that day to Lowes Online Customer Support which stated someone will call me from the store that it was fulfilled to fix the problem. I called the store this time and they wanted me to uninstall everything and just give me a whole new one which i stated that I couldn't do that because i paid someone to connect everything which would mean that i would have to pay them again. She stated that they couldn't help me with that. I finally convinced them to just order the storage shelve that was dented and it would maybe take 2 months. At this point Im like whatever. They get me to Chris the appliance guy and he states that they have a whole unit in stock and they would deliver that shelve to me the next day. I was happy and ready to put this behind me. If only it was that easy. Chris stated that someone would call me the next morning to inform me of the time frame that day for delivery. They never called or showed up. That was Monday. I have been calling multiply time today to try and get this resolved but no one is answering their phone in the delivery department. Very frustrated and wish this issue would be fixed already

name: Layla Hening
text: Hit or miss if there is customer service available but nice store all in all

name: Marquis C Jones Sr.
text: Awesome experience today... I love it at this Lowe's

name: Joshua Baker

name: preston davis AL
text: Good store hours I can go in before work if I need something

name: Katie Malone
text: I recently purchased appliances for the first time from Lowe's. This was the worst experience I have ever had with a store - big or small. After multiple set up deliveries that never showed, I had to call the store, spend way too long on the call carousel, and ultimately had to take my complaints to corporate. When they were forced to call me back, I felt like my problems had been resolved, and my appliance would be delivered. The next day, I received an email that my fridge was ready to be picked up. After calling the store AGAIN, it was finally sorted out. I think I got lucky and spoke to someone who cared that it had been nearly two months of waiting. After the microwave with the original delivery didn't fit my space, Lowe's in Fultondale denied my return on day 57 of 60 with no reasoning except that their "policy had just changed." I will no longer shop at Lowe's. What a nightmare.

text:
I've tried to call Lowe's for days. I walk into Lowe's today and trying to ask for help while watching 2 separate employees goof off. One boy even hanging with his friend while I waited for help. And after one guy helped me and rushed to finish with me and gave me the wrong part so he could get back to his friend.
I saw customersreluctant to engage him because they thought he was also with a customer who was actually the friend. they were making plans for what they wanted to do after he got off.

name: Tonya Sanders
text: I went to this location to buy a washer, the guy in appliance was all over the place to busy to help anyone. I finally got his attention long enough for him to tell me they are sold out of washers. That they only had one left. Well I got the one they had. Waited a week to get it delivered when it arrived it was dented up, I sent it back they brought me another out. After getting it in and hooked up and reading the manual on it it wasn’t what I was looking for. I might would have realized that had the guy that was half way helping us wouldn’t have been so pushy on us making our mind up. I called them over an hour with no answer are they would pick up and hang up. So I went down there the manager was outright rude and rolled her eyes at me. Finally got some help in getting it scheduled for pick up and refunded. So I went to the Loews in Trussville to get another washer because this location said the same thing we are sold out. Fultondale was supposed to pick this washer up today and Trussville bring my new one out. Fultondale still has not picked up their washer yet and I have tried to call for over an hour and no answer or the hang up on me. I am a manager and know how busy and crazy it can be but that is why you have employees with good customer service skills to help. Fultondale dose not have good management or customer service.

text: We always go to Lowe's in fultondale for our live Christmas trees..they are easily accessible and have people to help you net them and put them into your car..very reasonable and we had to keep our tree up after Christmas for our grandsons visit and it looked just as fresh as it did when we purchased it..and very few needles fall off..i do recommend the tree stuff they sell in a bottle for like 2 or 3 dollars..it does extend the life of your tree and helps to keep it from drying out and a fire starting..always unplug trees guys when leaving home regardless..happy holidays

No only was the price better but the staff there knew exactly what i needed.  They were great!!!!   Forget Lowes and go to Ace.  You wont regret it.

name: Daman Cross
text: I had been avoiding going to Lowe's because the last time that we where there I was in pretty good health but since then I have had some issues to arise and I can not walk long distances any more so I was very surprised when we arrived and I saw that they had the carts to assist you with getting around the store thank you so much for that you just do not know I relieved I was and I was able to purchase everything that I had been putting off to do.  Thank you so much again.

name: Alex Berryhill
text: The people were very rude and very slow. I'm a contractor and it messes my whole day up when I have to go. Sadly it's not just one it almost every lowes or home depot

name: Mazy Holiday
text: I have tried to call this store's delivery department and/or someone who can have an order waiting at the store delivered (when you cannot go pick it up) and No One answered the phone for 4 days of calling.  Whether you get the operator or not, whether you tell the operator you problem, doesn't matter how you go about it, you cannot get anyone to help you. When you get someone from a different department on the phone, they either put you on hold forever, or transfer you to another unmanned phone.  How they have 4 stars is a mystery, clearly no one is calling them for assistance.

name: Jimmy Welch
text:
Never had a bad experience shopping here....Today replaced the bad thermocouple on my water heater.
Looks like a 10 dollar part fixed the problem.
Pilot light would not stay lit.
Working now. ......installed a Honeywell thermocouple...24 inch.

text: It's Lowe's, y'all! Why do you need my review? They're outstanding!

name: Katie Franklin
text:
This is the worse experience ever. I went in on Friday order blocks for my new home being delivered today and I had to call to see why it was taken so long guess what they dont even have the blocks. How can you make someone pay for something and guarantee they will be delivered by that day if you dont have it.
On top of that no one called me to let me know ,I called them because my home is here.
Thank you Fultondale Lowes for the worse Service Ever. I WILL NEVER BE BACK.

text: I love Lowe's. Everyone is helpful. I like their prices and warranties on their tools.

I am 83 yrs old and had 3 bags of sand which all of it had gotten damp and I had to stop a customer in parking lot to help me load it in my car. Very, very poor service.

text: Lowe's most always has what's needed. If out of stock, the product will be ordered and can be picked up or delivered.

name: Bonlynren McG
text:
I most always find what I want or need here.  However,  today there were no employees around to ask paint questions to.  😓 There was one lady working in that department but she was  with a customer.  After meandering around,  trying to find the correct the paint,  I asked a gentleman,  who was a customer.  Thank GOODNESS,  he was  extremely knowledgeable and stayed with me for 10 minutes until I found the exact product I needed for my wooden steps.

So,  why do I see a lot of employees working yet and no one is available to ask a simple question of?  Yes,  I could have interrupted her,  like several others did.  But I chose not to do that.

text: Worse customer service ever. Employees are very rude and do not have proper communication skills.  Refused to help customers and had multiple people waiting and do not answer phones.  Constantly saying things are not there jobs. Just completely unacceptable.

text: I recently made several improvements to my home in preparation to put it on the market. I probably visited Lowe’s at least 2-3 times a week for over a month. Their department customer service is lacking. I learned to just ask the some customers because they seemed to know more than the employees. There was an exception and that was the Pro-Desk employees. They’re great Monday through Friday. Don’t waste your time checking out up front, if you’re preparing for a project, go through the pro-desk area. They know what they’re doing.

Im not the only one that feels this way and if there were any competition in the area I know they would do little to no business. name: Collins
text:
Horrible customer service!
I placed an order online yesterday, so I could get an early start on my home project. The plan was to run by Lowe’s, grab my order, and leave. After sitting, walking, and standing around for a little over an hour- my order still had not been pulled and put together yet.

I asked for a refund and went to my car, I sat in Lowe’s parking lot and placed an online order  at Home Depot and received a text within an hour and a half that my order was already ready for pickup.

Will never use Lowe’s (especially in Fultondale) again!

text: Frustrating! This place is gotten to where it is a mess everytime I come. Carts all over the parking lot overflowing the cart return....ZERO inside where they are supposed to be. Same thing happened last time I shopped for wood...there were wood carts inside but were full of things blocking the wood and aisles yet appeared not to belong to customers. I had to go out into the parking lot to get a cart....none near the doors. The last two times I have shopped for a power tool the aisles have also been blocked with ladders and merchandise yet no employees around that appear to be stocking. They apparently just drop it in the aisles and leave it there. Come on guys!! Looks like they need some new management!

If I could rate negative stars I would. Absolutely the worst place I have ever gone.

She said she would find someone to help and left me for 15 minutes and came back and keyed something in and sold it to me. I was late picking up my son from school causing him to be sent to after school care and charging me $50. I am disgusted with this place and won't be back. name: Jacqueline Dorris
text: This Lowes really needs to work on their employee culture and overall customer service. Over the past several years, my husband and I have purchased several large appliances. All of which were a nightmare of an experience.  No communication about delivery and expectations once your item is paid for. No delivery confirmations/calls from the "warehouse". The first items were a washer and dryer and fridge - they showed up 2 days late. Frustrating considering we needed the items urgently AND we took time off to be there at delivery time. Most recent was a dishwasher. The man in the back who sold us the dishwasher seemed like he would rather be anywhere BUT work. Honestly, we would have walked right out if it wasn't for the fact that I had some rewards to use at Lowes. He gave no information and in fact, told me I should "search online and compare dishwashers" because he wasn't an expert and didn't have a say on any of them. Then we asked about delivery. He had no info - not even on the process and we explained we had a bad experience before. Instead of sticking up for or explaining to us that maybe it was a fluke, he went on to talk about the "warehouse" and how many complaints they get on them. Not very reassuring. Our dishwasher didn't show up today so we will be canceling our order and we just opened a Home Depot account - so Lowes, you have lost a customer.

name: Sir Consumer
text:
Today July 7, 2020, Lowe's in Fultondale seems to minimize the risk of Covid 19 by allowing patrons to opt in or out on a county wide mask wearing mandate. Sadly I noticed today and  just a few days ago the same practices. THE MASK should cover the nose and the mouth! It isn't a college or super intellectual level of comprehension. Air is taken in thru the nasal passage as well as by mouth.
Jefferson County is under a county wide mask required mandate. This is to protect everyone. This mandate is essential in providing some precautions allowing businesses to stay open. Why are patrons allowed to enter Lowe's without a mask?? No mask No entry.
Cigerettes and pets aren't allowed due to potential dangers and risk to others. Wearing a mask is no different. It provides some safety measures as the rules No Pets and No Smoking inside.

text:
Went to the local Lowe's to purchase some blinds.  I needed one to be cut to fit my window but left after waiting for an hour and never getting any help.  I asked multiple employees, went to customer service to get help, and even called them on the phone from within the store hoping to reach someone that could help.  No one ever came.   One employee did try to get someone to come help us but no one ever did.

This is not my first experience having extended wait times only to have no one come to help.  In addition checkout wait times are usually high when I have been as there are only one or two registers open.  Even when they see the lines building up it takes them so long to get another register open that it's pointless.

name: Melissa Thomas
text: My husband, a veteran and law enforcement officer, and I just left this location not even 10 minutes ago. We went in to return a work desk that he had purchased yesterday, only to come home and find out that pieces are broken and missing. When we arrived at the return desk we were greeted angrily by a lady named Shelia (her tag said CSA Front Desk). She was in the process of helping another gentleman with a wheelbarrow at the time we arrived so I shrugged her attitude off as frustration to begin with. By the time she got to us she took the receipt from my husband, asked angrily what was wrong to which he informed her that the desk portion (the main part of the item) was broken down the middle and pieces were missing. She rolled her eyes, mumbled a few things, then started to walk away and as she was walking into another room yelled back at us "you know it's a clearance item right?!"  She then came back out of that room, struggled to get the lid off the box and then continued to tell us in a displeasing tone that our kobalt work desk was on clearance. I then stated "so does clearance mean that pieces are broken? If so, lowes should not be selling clearance items". She then argued with me that clearance items are usually returns with missing pieces and I restated that the main portion of the item is completely broken in half. I don't care if it's clearance or not, it was not marked down nearly enough to compensate for a complete useless, damaged piece. She then slammed a refund receipt down and asked my husband to sign. She never asked if we wanted to swap it with a usable piece. She never asked anything, actually. During this entire transaction she was rude and everything anyone in customer service should not be. She was also complaining and cussing under her breath about no one answering the phone around there during our entire few minutes with her. When we were leaving there were 2 more men waiting patiently behind us and just staring in disbelief at what they witnessed and would unfortunately encounter. I told one man good luck as we walked off and he said it looked like he needed it. Needless to say, if lowes in fultondale is going to hire individuals of her caliber, we will not step foot back in that store and may in fact just take our business to Home Depot.

name: JohnDoe Beats
text: We went here to purchase cabinets, the process started on Nov. 21st 2016. We have spent over $20k in the past 6months. It took them four times to measure our kitchen correctly, also had a lady insult my fiancé in our own home. Finally when we ordered the cabinets a few weeks later, we were told it would take 30 days to get them in and possibly a week extra to get them installed. Two days before we were supposed to get the cabinets in we received an email from the man we was working with stating that he was sorry, the order was incorrect and said he was leaving that he couldn't help us any longer. Well 3 cabinets were missing, and was measured incorrectly...... AGAIN. Don is the assistant manager over there and is terrible. We met with him and got another person to come measure... again and said we had to wait another 30days before it could be here and another 1-2weeks to install. Well the installer said when they got here he couldn't finish the trim because something was not finished. Don has told us from the start that we would sit down and discuss what needs to be done to make this right. I have called lowes 20 times and got Don at least 10 and said he would call me back. HE NEVER DOES. I have asked for the store manager Jeff left messages, still no answer. We have been dealing with this for 6 months and spent a lot of money for a normal person. LOWES IS THE WORST STORE, MOST OF THEIR EMPLOYEES ARE RUDE AND HAVE NO CUSTOMER SERVICE ABILTIY AT ALL. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND LOWES TO ANYBODY EVER.

text:
Went to the local Lowe's to purchase some blinds.  I needed one to be cut to fit my window but left after waiting for an hour and never getting any help.  I asked multiple employees, went to customer service to get help, and even called them on the phone from within the store hoping to reach someone that could help.  No one ever came.   One employee did try to get someone to come help us but no one ever did.

This is not my first experience having extended wait times only to have no one come to help.  In addition checkout wait times are usually high when I have been as there are only one or two registers open.  Even when they see the lines building up it takes them so long to get another register open that it's pointless.

text: We recently purchased a Lawn mower from Lowe's and used it 2 times and then it started sputtering and smoking and would not crank.  We bought the extended warranty with the mower, but when we tried to bring it back they made us pay $80.00 to send it off to be worked on and then they called us a week later and told us the mower had contaminated gas and it would not be covered under the warranty and it was going to cost us $127.00 to fix. We put brand new gas in the mower before we used it.  We will NEVER again purchase one of Lowe's warranty's because they do NOT stand behind their product.

I don’t drink or do drugs my job is highly strict about that but of course I’m judged for being me and looking how I look (black ) god saved me because I won’t spend a penny with rent A-Center I’ll rather go to Aaron’s where they make everyone feel equal ....

name: Mitchell Liles
text: Terrible! I've been meaning to write this review for a view weeks now. We went into Aaron's because we are currently renting from them right now. I've rented from them over the years ,and always suggest them to family, and friends. Well we went in there around 3 to see about getting a new bed. We wanted an adjustable base bed. Well after walking in we wasn't greeted until about 5 minutes a lady walks up front and says what are you looking for so we let her know. Instead of her helping us, and generally they order it for you, and give you information on what your looking for. She told us oh you can do that online.. that's it all she said. I said kindly we would like for you to do it so that we can know from A to B what's going on. She just did not want to help us at all she gave us every excuse in the book. Well finally it seemed like she was going to order it for us. Well she went out the front door where the manager he was smoking in his car and said something to him. I don't know what prompted her to even go out there, but she did. Well she comes in and says oh those are on back order.. it was like wow okay! Well can you give us more information? No we don't know when they'll be available.. She was just terrible!!! She was extremely ditzy. She does not know how to work she was rude she is bit made for a customer service job. I can't remember her name I wish I could! But she had blonde curly stringy hair and was talking about her boyfriend and how he could fit on the bed we were looking at. The manager is nasty for smoking right up front and didn't care there was people needing help that's not a manager. I don't know if Charity is still working there, but that's who I've delt with years ago and she was amazing! That's why I came back, but I haven't seen her. Anyways!We went to mattress firm and that lady turned our whole day around after leaving Aaron's. Our bed is awesome, and we got a good price maybe your sucky service was a blessing. Either way after we are done paying our dryer off we won't be back

name: Brenda Johnson Lawrence
text:
Update on my previous review: Management finally returned my call. She was out sick since New Year's. She made our purchase good and replaced the damaged furniture. However, I am going to leave the initial review below this update, and raise the stars to a 3 instead of 1. This store really needs to evaluate their customer service skills and improve by taking care of issues in a timely manner.
Initial Review:
Horrible experience! Do not shop here! They sold us defective furniture that damaged our hardwood floors and no-one returns the calls. The delivery men were still at my house when I showed them the sofa was reclining and digging into the floors! The sofa reclined and left a deep two-foot-long scratch in our new hardwood floors. They replaced the sofa on Dec 31 and I showed them the loveseat is lopsided. They tried to fix it but couldn't. It has been over three weeks and these people do not return your calls nor stand behind their products! Don't shop here! I wish I had read these reviews before we shopped with Farmers! We are going to buy new bedroom furniture and a new refrigerator, but not from farmers!

text: I was in a hurry to find a bedroom suit. Was going to pay cash if they had a discount for a cash purchase. They did not so I did a 90 day same as cash. The problem is the delivery, they dented and scratched the dresser. Also put dens and scratches in the wall. I took pics and showed the delivery people. Called the Manger she a asked for pics. I sent them to her cell phone. After repeated attempts I could not get her on the phone. I went to the store several times. I was told she was not in. NO one else would help me. Due to she was the contact and it was her investigation. They won I gave up, it was cheaper for me to fix the walls. And cover up the dented and scratched dresser. Then it was than continue to try and chase them down. It's a shame they could have had a long term customer. If they would have been fair. Rather than dishonest.
